name: Mojito
description: Delivering zesty lime with fresh mint and a backbone of crystal clear, smooth Captain Morgan® White Rum, the classic Mojito cocktail recipe has all the ingredients for a great party – enjoy it with the crew!

instructions.description: Muddle sugar and lime wedges together in a glass. Press down on 2 wedges of lime and 2 teaspoons of caster sugar in a tankard or jar using a large spoon or pestle to extract flavour and aroma. Press down gently on the mint, together with the sugar and lime.Add crushed ice so the glass is ¾ full with ice cubes
Pour in Captain Morgan® White Rum and a dash of soda water.
Stir the mixture thoroughly using a bar spoon until well combined.
Top up with more crushed ice and garnish with a sprig of mint.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.DRINKS CALCULATOR

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Soda
description: A version of the classic mixed drink that uses the blended Johnnie Walker Red Label for a well-balanced, clean, delicious drink to enjoy on many occasions. #letscocktail

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and soda into the glass.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and 125ml soda water into the glass.
Garnish with a wedge of lime. With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Peach Metro
description: The simple addition of tonic creates a surprising burst of zesty, deliciously fruity peach with a sweet bitter combination that provides a delicious finish to this popular drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Peach Schnapps Liqueur and 125ml tonic into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a wedge of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Alabama Slammer
description: Rich almond notes, fruity Sloe Gin and fresh orange meld for this fruit-and-nut classic that's perfect for parties – on the rocks or as a shooter.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Sloe Gin, 25ml Southern Comfort, 25ml Amaretto almond liqueur and 25ml orange juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled. Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a short glass over ice cubes.
Cut a slice of orange, using a sharp knife and chopping board, and secure to the rim of the glass.

name: Peach Schnapps & Lemonade
description: The lemonade mixer lengthens and lightens the peach flavour, making a subtle drink that's ideal for warmer days, or when you want to think of good times spent in the sun.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Peach Schnapps Liqueur and 125ml lemonade into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a wedge of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka Rickey
description: Unlike the Gin Rickey, the inventor of the vodka version is unknown, but this mixture of cool, triple-distilled vodka with a balancing lime juice and sugar syrup, then topped with soda is a classic sweet-sour mix that has stood the test of time.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka, 17.5ml lime juice and 10ml sugar syrup into a the shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain the drink with a cocktail strainer into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice. Pour in 90ml soda water to top up.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a twist of lime peel and place over the edge of the glass to garnish.

name: Kiss Above the Clouds by Cross Yu
description: Based on a Manhattan, Kiss Above The Clouds was created by Cross Yu, China’s Bartender of the Year. It’s rich and warm, smooth yet complex, with a long lasting finish, and garnished with a small homemade side of grilled orange and cinnamon that complements the drink’s chocolate flavours.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 60ml Dark Rum, 20ml sweet vermouth, 5ml coffee liqueur, 5ml Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve and 2 dashes chocolate bitters into the glass.
Stir the liquid slowly with a bar spoon until the mixing glass feels chilled. Use a cocktail strainer to strain into an Old Fashioned glass that contains one piece of ice.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a twist of orange peel and place over the edge of the glass. Add in a stick of cinnamon to garnish.

tags.name: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve Whisky

name: Peach Schnapps & Orange Juice
description: A less well-known combination that mixes the subtle sweetness of the Peach Schnapps with tart, fresh orange juice for a great drink that's ideal at any time.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Peach Schnapps Liqueur and 125ml orange juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, slice a piece of orange peel and twist into the glass to garnish.

name: Lady Killer
description: There’s a whole spectrum of luscious, tropical and summer fruits in this cocktail that, when combined with London Dry Gin and elegantly stirred, make a fabulous drink.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 25ml London Dry Gin, 50ml passion fruit juice, 50ml pineapple juice, 17.5ml apricot brandy and 17.5ml orange liqueur into the glass.
Using a bar spoon stir the mixture until well combined. Strain into a highball glass using a cocktail strainer.
Use a chopping board and sharp knife to cut a lime wedge and place in the drink to garnish.

name: Peach Schnapps & Pineapple Juice
description: A double serving of warm climate fruit gives you a sense of being out in the sun, great for mixing when you have friends over and want to create that holiday feeling.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Peach Schnapps Liqueur and 125ml pineapple juice into the glass.

name: Aviation
description: A great mix of flavours, the Aviation cocktail is the perfect introduction to gin cocktails. This citrussy, lightly floral blend of gin, maraschino and lemon is a classic cocktail recipe from the Jazz Age, when aeroplanes were the latest thing and exotic enough to inspire bartenders.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 60ml London Dry Gin, 15ml maraschino liqueur, 10ml crème de violette and 25ml fresh lemon juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled.Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass using a cocktail strainer.
Place a cherry in the glass to garnish.

name: Angus Collins
description: A sour based on the huge peat-smoke that’s typical of southern Islay whisky, the powerful flavour, attractive garnishes and tasty mixers of this cocktail make it the ideal party serve.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Single Malt Whisky, 50ml sour mix and 17.5ml orange juice into the shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled. Use a cocktail strainer to strain the liquid into a tall glass filled with crushed ice. Top up with 25ml of carbonated water.
Use a sharp knife to cut a strip of lemon peel on a chopping board and twist onto the rim of the glass, along with one cherry to garnish.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
description: An unusual blend of vodka, gin, tequila, rum and orange liqueur with cola, the Long Island Iced Tea flavours of vanilla and lightly tannic wood make it taste a little like tea, but in fact they come from a mix of quality aged spirits.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.

Using a jigger, measure 17.5ml Captain Morgan Spiced, 17.5ml vodka, 17.5ml London Dry Gin, 17.5ml orange liqueur, 17.5ml Blanco Tequila, 17.5ml sugar syrup, 15ml lemon juice and 17.5ml lime juice into a shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled. Use a cocktail strainer to strain the liquid into a Highball glass filled with cubes of ice. Pour cola into the drink to fill to the top of the glass.
Cut a slice of lemon with a sharp knife on a chopping board and place in the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys B52
description: The B52 is the classic shot. Its impressive looks are worth the effort, but don’t overlook its delicious creamy, orange and coffee flavours as well.

instructions.description: Pour 10ml Coffee Liqueur’ into a shot glass.

Gently pour 10ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur down the back of a bar spoon into the glass while keeping the spoon end against the inside wall of the glass.Repeat for a third layer with Orange Liqueur.

name: Baileys Chocolat Luxe
description: New Baileys Chocolat Luxe captures the rich flavour and velvety texture of delicious dark chocolate in an intense, luxurious drink that delivers your favourite Baileys with truly indulgent appeal.

instructions.description: Place three ice cubes into a wine glass.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Chocolat Luxe into the glass.
Carefully pierce a single raspberry with an elegant skewer known as an ‘attelet’, and place across the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Mango Fizz
description: The tropical taste of mango combines with mint, lime and fiery Ginger Ale to create a deliciously zesty long drink.

instructions.description: Clap the mint in you palms to releases the aromas and place at the bottom of the tall glass. Add your sugar syrup and mango puree on top of the mint.
Fill your glass 3/4 full with crushed ice (important to use crushed Ice to ensure maximum flavour).
Stir everything together well and top with further crushed ice and garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Baileys Chocolate Orange
description: The perfect Christmas cocktail, Baileys Chocolate Orange mixes the classic flavours of the season, chocolate and orange, for a delicious, indulgent serve.

instructions.description: Place 3 ice cubes in a rocks glass.
Using a jigger, measure 35ml Baileys Chocolat Luxe and 25ml Orange Liqueur into the glass.
Stir the mixture with a bar spoon until the mixture is well combined.
Grate a stick of cinnamon over the top of the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys Eggnog
description: The classic, homely combination can be done deliciously and simply as here: a pour of Baileys Original Irish Cream, plus egg, milk and a pinch of nutmeg for a great serve.

instructions.description: In a large bowl, whisk together 1 egg and 1tbsp caster sugar until creamy and the sugar begins to dissolve.

Mix in 35ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur and 75ml milk. Stir in the seeds from a vanilla pod, scraped out with a teaspoon. Using a grater, grate the sides of a whole nutmeg into the bowl. With a cocktail strainer, strain the mixture into a Cognac glass.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Manhattan
description: The yin to the martini cocktail's yang, the Manhattan is one of the all-time great classic cocktails, a rich, sweet blend of whisky, vermouth and bitters that’s generally stirred into perfection.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Single Malt Whisky, 25ml sweet vermouth and a dash of angostura bitters into a mixing glass.
Fill mixing glass with ice and stir with a bar spoon. Using a strainer, strain into a martini glass.
Using chopping board and sharp knife slice an orange twist and add on top of the drink, along with one cherry, to garnish.

name: Margarita
description: Nothing says Mexico like the Margarita, an elegant blend of tequila, fresh lime and orange, served in a salt-rimmed glass – and the last of the great classic cocktails. Try the classic method here, or blitz all the ingredients with ice in a blender for an easy frozen cocktail- which is great for parties!

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubed ice.
Use a jigger to measure 35ml Orange Liqueur, 50ml Tequila and 25ml lime juice to the shaker.
Shake until chilled. Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a short glass.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.DRINKS CALCULATOR

name: Martinez
description: All that glitters is not gold, and sometimes the best things in life aren’t staring you in the face.The Martinez cocktail recipe might not have a pile of biscuits layered on top, or smoke pouring over the side, but it’s the ultimate drink – impressive in its own way.Mix up a Martinez cocktail because it has both history and flavour on its side.

instructions.description: Half-fill a glass with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin, 10ml red vermouth, 5ml maraschino liqueur and a dash of angostura aromatic bitters into the glass.

Place a bar spoon at the bottom of the glass and gently turn to combine all ingredients.Pour the liquid through a cocktail strainer or small sieve into a coupe glass that’s been chilled in the fridge.
Using a small knife or vegetable peeler, cut a think piece of peel from one turn of an orange. Place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Merry Mule
description: Kick your party into action with this fine Merry Mule cocktail recipe. It’s the right way to spice up your Christmas party – a combination of tasty Ginger Ale and vodka that will have guests galloping over to celebrate.

instructions.description: Fill a mug or highball glass with ice cubes.
Add 50mlVodka to the glass. Add lime juice and Ginger Ale. Add in 10ml lime juice.Top up with 140ml Ginger Ale, or enough to fill the glass.

Cut a slice of lemon and push 5 cloves into the slice. Place on top of the drink to garnish. Add 1 stick of cinnamon and use to stir the drink.PRO: Add a teaspoon of ginger syrup to super spice your mule!

name: Mojito Ho, Ho
description: Enjoy this laugh-a-minute Mojito Ho, Ho cocktail recipe, with a splash of Caribbean rum and a drop of joviality in the spirit of Santa. This mix of Captain Morgan Original Rum, Ginger Ale, mint and cranberry will be the centre of attention at your festive gathering.

instructions.description: Press down on 2 tsp caster sugar, 1 slice of ginger, 6 mint leaves and 8 cranberries in a highball glass using a rolling pin or spoon to extract flavour and aroma.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Add 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 20ml lime juice to the glass.
Using a bar spoon, stir until the ingredients are well combined. Add 130ml Ginger Ale, or enough to fill the glass.
Add a sprig of mint and 2 cranberries on top of the drink to garnish.PRO: Add a dash of mandarin liqueur to spice up your mojito! (0.1 units)

name: Baileys Freakshake
description: Get your Freakshakes on! It’s time to enjoy the Baileys Freakshake, a cocktail recipe with so many layers of naughty deliciousness that your guests might remove one when you’re not looking. Wave them off with one hand as you blend with the other, and make sure you’ve the full dairy quota in this delicious recipe. Milk it for all it’s worth!

instructions.description: Using a tablespoon, smear 4 tbsp chocolate spread inside a tall glass or mug and around and over the rim.Holding the glass upside down, place in a small bowl or plate of 3 tbsp sprinkles so they stick to the rim of the glass.Add 3 scoops ice cream, 50ml coffee, 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur and 125ml milk to a blender.
Turn on the blender and blend until all the ingredients are combined. Pour into the tall glass or mug.Using a whisk, beat cream until it forms solid peaks.
Place 1 scoop ice cream, 3tbsp whipped cream on top of the drink, followed by a chocolate brownie and drizzle over 1tbsp. Chocolate sauce and 1 tbsp sprinkles to garnish.

name: Moorea Volcano by Diego Barcellos
description: Inspired by an island paradise, Moorea Volcano perfectly balances the sweet and citrus notes of Blanco Tequila with the fresh lemon juice and sugar found in homemade coriander syrup.

instructions.description: Pour the lemon juice into a shaker. Add the coriander seed syrup.This is made by grinding up coriander seeds, then mixing them with 1 part hot water and 1 part sugar.Add the Blanco Tequila, Angostura bitters, dragon fruit juice and papaya purée.The dragon and papaya fruits are native to both the French Polynesian Islands and Brazil.
Shake with a generous helping of ice.This cools the cocktail and gives it an overall freshness.Double strain into a tall glass. Straining helps remove any excess fruit pulp.
Garnish with lemongrass and papaya. This gives a fresh finish to the cocktail.

name: Baileys French Dream
description: This takes the coffee and Baileys combinations so beloved of party guests one step further with the addition of raspberry liqueur. You’ll see why people love this so much.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubed ice.
Using a jigger, measure 35ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, 25ml raspberry liqueur and 35ml coffee liqueur, add all to the shaker and shake until chilled.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.
Using a cocktail strainer strain into a rocks glass filled with cubes of ice. Garnish with raspberries.

name: Baileys Honey Bee
description: A real crowd-pleasing combination of honey and whisky, with Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur that ramps up the delicious creamy texture, this leads to a subtly sweet finish that lingers on the palate.

instructions.description: Fill a shaker with cubed ice.
Using a jigger, measure 75ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, 25ml Bell's Original Blended Scotch Whisky and 10ml honey into the shaker.
Shake until chilled.
Strain into a tumbler filled with cubes of ice.

name: Baileys Iced Frappe
description: Enjoy a delicious cold coffee, known as 'frappe', that's made with Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur and blended until smooth, offering a great drink for warmer days with a few friends.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 80ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur and 80ml milk, a cup of ice and 1tbsp brewed coffee into a blender.
Blend until the liquid is smooth enough to drink. Pour into a tall glass, and serve with a straw.
Using a grater, grate pieces of chocolate on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys Latte
description: The classic drink that's an espresso lengthened by hot milk is enriched and lifted by a pour of delicious Baileys Original Irish Cream, adding a subtle creaminess.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 135ml milk into a saucepan and heat gently. Measure 25ml freshly made espresso into a latte glass. Add the warm milk.
With the jigger, measure 50ml of Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur into the glass.

name: Baileys Midnight Mint
description: Regularly treated as the ideal after-dinner drink, this fine, shaken combination of Baileys Original Irish Cream and mint liqueur also works as a fantastic aperitif.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, 25ml mint liqueur and 25ml Smirnoff No. 21 Vodka into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.With a cocktail strainer, strain into a wine glass.
Place a mint leaf on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys Orange Bliss
description: The ultimate indulgent drink, combining the ultimate luxury cognac and Orange Liqueur with the rich, creamy textured Baileys Original Irish Cream.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream and 25ml Orange Liqueur into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a martini glass filled with ice cubes.
With a sharp knife and cutting board, cut a slice of orange, twist and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Negroni
description: With Mediterranean herbs, and a hint of orange and gin botanicals, the Negroni recipe is full of flavour – and history. This classic Italian cocktail is loved by bartenders for its subtle bitterness and use of vermouth.

instructions.description: Fill a short glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml London Dry Gin, 25ml vermouth Rosso and 25ml campari into the glass.
Stir with a bar spoon until the ingredients are well combined. Strain into a glass filled with ice. Using a cocktail strainer, strain the mixture into a short glass filled with ice cubes.
With a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a piece of orange peel and twist over the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Paloma
description: Created by bartender Don Javier Delgado Corona, the Paloma is considered by many Mexicans to be their native cocktail, even above the more internationally known Margarita.Corona has invented a drink that is essentially a long, fruity Margarita. Inevitably with the local spirit close at hand there are bound to be ever-increasing renditions of the Margarita.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila, 25ml grapefruit juice, 25ml fresh lime juice and 17.5ml simple syrup into the glass.
Top with 25ml soda water.
With a sharp knife cut a wedge of lime on a chopping board, and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys Original Irish Cream & Coffee
description: Brew a pot of freshly made coffee to complete the rich, subtly creamy texture of Baileys Original Irish Cream for this drink that's finished, cappuccino-style, with shavings of chocolate.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream and 110ml freshly made coffee into a short glass.

name: Baileys Original Irish Cream Hot Chocolate
description: A delicious variation on the classic hot chocolate drink, this adds a fabulous rich, creamy dimension that's not hard to create but made to be savoured with a few friends.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 150ml hot chocolate into a saucepan and heat gently.
Pour into a short glass with 50ml of Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur.
Squirt whipped cream onto the drink and sprinkle chocolate curls on top of the cream.

name: Baileys Over Ice
description: A simply satisfying drink that can be enjoyed by anyone, anytime. Smooth sweet Baileys poured over ice satisfies as soon as it touches your lips.

instructions.description: Fill a short glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream into a short glass.

name: Baileys Pumpkin Spice Latte
description: The Baileys Pumpkin Spice Latte is for lovers of latte with a little extra. And that seems to be quite a few of you, as pumpkin spice is the flavour of the moment. Just beat the takeaways by making it at home using Baileys Pumpkin Spice Liqueur.

instructions.description: Add 150ml warm coffee to a tumbler or mug.Pour in 50ml Baileys Pumpkin Spice to the tumbler or mug.
Top with 50ml milk.
Garnish with 2tbsp whipped cream, 1/8 tsp ground nutmeg and a whole cinnamon stick.

name: Non Alcoholic Mojito
description: Mint, apple, lime and elderflower combine to create this refreshing mocktail Mojito, topped with Soda Water. #letscocktail

instructions.description: Press down with a muddler on 6 mint leaves in the bottom of a tall glass to extract the juices and flavour.
Using a jigger, measure 30ml of apple juice, 20ml lime juice and 15ml elderflower cordial into a tall glass.
Fill the glass with crushed ice, and stir the drink with a bar spoon.Top up the drink with 40ml Soda Water.
Place a sprig of mint at an angle against the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Passion Fruit Caipiroska
description: Fruity, lively and deliciously balanced, with great-tasting vodka as its base, the Passion Fruit Caipiroska is a twist on classic Brazilian cocktail the Caipirinha that’s perfect for a summer of great sport.

instructions.description: Using a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a lime into quarters. Cut a passion fruit in half and dig a spoon into the passion fruit to remove the flesh inside.
Place 4 lime wedges, ½ passion fruit and a tablespoon of brown sugar in a tumbler. Using a jigger, measure 12.5ml sugar syrup into the tumbler.
Press down on the contents of the glass using a muddler to extract juices and flavour.
Top with crushed ice and, using a jigger, measure 40ml vodka into the glass.
Using a barspoon, stir the mixture until the ingredients are well combined.Top with more crushed ice.

name: Basil Grande
description: One of a number of great cocktails created by bartender Jamie Wilkinson when at the Living Room bar in Manchester, dating from 2001, this fine long drink blends raspberry liqueur, strawberries and tart cranberry with Ketel One Vodka for a delicious red fruit mix.

instructions.description: Press down with a muddler on 4 strawberries and 5 basil leaves to extract the juices and flavour in a cocktail shaker.Using jigger measure 20ml vodka, 20ml raspberry liqueur and 50ml of cranberry juice into the shaker.
Add ice cubes.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.
Using a cocktail strainer, strain the mixture into a martini glass.

name: Penny Black
description: This fine mixed drink takes the great mixing qualities of Scotch Whisky and adds sour, sweet and bitter in the form of grapefruit, honey and a dash of bitters for a burst of flavours.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml Scotch Whisky, 25ml pink grapefruit juice, 25ml honey water and 10ml lemon juice into the shaker. Add 2 dashes of bitters.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a short glass.
Place one cherry on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Blended Scotch Whisky & Ginger Ale
description: This simple drink tastes so impressive because the ginger ale picks out the spicy elements in a quality Scotch whisky blend, making for a punchy serve that’s great on the palate.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blended Scotch Whisky into the glass.
Top up with 50ml ginger ale.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a lime wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Pimm's No.1 & Lemonade
description: You can do plenty with Pimm's – a garnish here, lots more strawberries and cucumber there – but sometimes just a pour of lemonade makes for a great-tasting drink. #letscocktail

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour over the Pimm’s and Lemonade.
Give it a stir then add the strawberry, cucumber and orange.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Pimm's No1 & Ginger Ale
description: If it’s summer it’s Pimm’s – whether you’re celebrating, watching sport or just spending time with friends. So give your favourite outdoor tipple a touch of ginger ale. It’s a spicy twist on the classic drink, the coolest serve with a difference.

instructions.description: Fill a wine glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Pimm’s No.1 and 150ml ginger ale into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut one slice of cucumber, one slice of orange and one slice of lemon. Add to the glass. Place a sprig of mint on top to garnish.

name: The Crisp And Citrus Johnnie & Lemon
description: An easy-to-mix splash of lemonade with delicious blended whisky, this clean, long drink is perfect for time spent relaxing or with friends, a great way to savour the classic spirit.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker Black Label Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blended Scotch Whisky into the glass.
Top up with 50ml lemonade.
With a chopping board and sharp knife to cut a lemon wedge and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Between the Sheets
description: A fine little number from the days of Prohibition, Between the Sheets is a spirituous, citrussy martini packed with Morgan's and Orange Liqueur spice. Enjoy a taste of the 20s!

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, 25ml Orange Liqueur, 25ml brandy and 25ml fresh lemon juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled.Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass using a cocktail strainer.
Using a sharp knife, pare a thin strip of lemon peel zest. Snap to release the flavouring oils, and then drop into the drink.

name: Pimm's Punch
description: Punch has been around since the 17th century as the ideal sharing drink that combines five delicious ingredients, and the Pimm’s Punch celebrates fruit, with flavours of apple, zesty citrus and tart passion fruit – plus the delicious herb-tinged fruits of Pimm’s No.1.

instructions.description: Place the raspberries in a mason jar or a mug. Add 50ml of Pimm’s No.1 to the mug.Using a jigger, measure 30 orange juice, 30ml apple juice, 15ml lemon juice and 20ml passion fruit syrup into the mug.Adjust citrus juice and liqueurs so that the sweet–sour balance is to your liking.
Place the mug in the fridge for 2–3 hours to chill before serving.
Remove the mug from the fridge gently stir and serve.
If you want to make a batch of cocktails, then adjust the serve calculator in the ingredients section to your required amount of serves and then follow the method by mixing in a large bowl or jug.

name: Pink Lady
description: An elegant mixture of gin, fruity grenadine rounded out with egg white, and balanced with lemon juice, the Pink Lady cocktail recipe was once the gin cocktail of choice – and when it comes to mixing for your next party you’ll see why.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin, 25ml triple sec and 25ml lemon juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain into a martini glass using a cocktail strainer.
With a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a piece of lemon peel and twist it over the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Pomelo
description: A long cocktail that combines the grapefruit-like taste of the Pomelo with sweet orange juice and brandy, it’s a great fruity drink with serious mixing credentials.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
With a jigger pour 50ml vodka, 50ml brandy, 80ml pomelo juice and 50ml orange juice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain mixture into a tall glass filled with ice cubes.

name: Port in a Storm
description: One of the great mixed drinks using two base spirits, this combines Johnnie Walker Red Label with cognac, but also the fortified Port for a dark, richly flavoured cocktail.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Pour 25ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky, 25ml ruby port and a dash of cognac into the glass.
Stir the mixture with a bar spoon until well combined.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a short glass.

name: Raspberry Caipiroska
description: Simple to make, zesty and delicious, the Raspberry Caipiroska is a twist on the classic Brazilian cocktail, the Caipirinha, with ripe fresh fruit pressed together with a dash of sugar to create the ideal summer sport serve.

instructions.description: Using a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a lime into quarters.Place 4 lime wedges, 5 raspberries and a tablespoon of brown sugar in a tumbler.Using a jigger, measure 12.5ml sugar syrup into the tumbler.
Press down on the contents of the glass using a muddler to extract juices and flavour.
Top with crushed ice and, using a jigger, measure 40ml vodka into the glass.Using a bar spoon, stir the mixture until the ingredients are well combined. Top with more crushed ice.

name: Rich and Famous
description: A rich, creamy and striking blend of Baileys Original Irish Cream and Gold Vodka, Rich and Famous is the ultimate indulgent cocktail recipe. Grab a taste of the good life.

instructions.description: Add cubes of ice to a cocktail shaker.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Baileys Original Irish Cream and 25ml Gold Vodka into the cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain the mixture into a tumbler.
Using a fork or beater, whip double cream until it forms peaks. Add 1 tbsp whipped cream to the glass and pinch of cinnamon powder to garnish.

name: Blackberry Shrub Cocktail
description: Gordon’s Blackberry Shrub cocktail.

instructions.description: Gently wash the blackberries and place into a large clean jar and add the caster sugar and lavender. Secure a muslin square/cover over the opening of the jar. Place into the fridge and gently rock/shake daily for about 2-3 days until the sugar has dissolved.Once the fruit has macerated for a few days place in a pan with the vinegar and gently bring to a very light simmer on a med/low heat for about 5 minutes, softening the fruit. Cool the mixture to room temperature then strain through sieve into a jug, pushing it through with the back of a spoon. Sieve the collected liquid again, this time using a piece of muslin over the sieve, to get a finer shrub. Pour 100ml of shrub into a bottle, seal, label and store in the fridge. Keeps in the fridge for up to 4 months.
In a shaker add the gin, blackberry & lavender shrub, lemon juice and ice. Shake for at least 1 minute. Strain into 2 tall tumbler glasses filled with ice and top with tonic water.
Garnish with blackberries and a sprig of lavender.

name: Bloody Mary
description: The ultimate brunch cocktail, the world's favourite savoury drink, the Bloody Mary delivers a balance of sweet, salt, sour and umami flavours that is unlike any other.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka and 100ml tomato juice into the glass. Add 4 dashes of tabasco and worcestershire sauce, the juice of half a lemon and 2 grinds of black pepper.
Stir the ingredients together slowly using a bar spoon.
Place a celery stalk in the drink at an angle to garnish your Bloody Mary.

name: Rob Roy
description: Created in 1894 by a bartender at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City, the Rob Roy is a mix of Scotch whisky and vermouth that delivers a burst of sweet, earthy and spicy flavours.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Single Malt Whisky and 25ml sweet vermouth into the glass.
Stir the mixture using a bar spoon.Using a strainer, strain into a martini glass.
Place one cherry on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Blue Lagoon
description: A brilliant, turquoise 1970s classic, the Blue Lagoon may look and sound tropical, but it's a deliciously tangy, citrus harmony of vodka, blue curaçao and lemonade.

instructions.description: Fill a highball glass with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka and 150ml lemonade into the glass.
Stir the mixture until well combined.Drizzle 25ml blue curaçao liqueur over the mixture.
Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lemon and secure onto the rim of the glass.

name: Rum and Cola
description: Rum and Cola is an all-time classic recipe, with subtle caramelly cola and a zesty wedge of lime that’s best enjoyed with crystal clear, rounded flavour of delicious new Captain Morgan® White Rum.

instructions.description: Fill a tankard or rocks glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan® White Rum and 125ml cola into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, slice a wedge of lime and place in the drink to garnish.

name: Brandy Alexander
description: A version of the Brandy Alexander using Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, this captures the spirit of the cocktail as a delicious, creamy variation.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Baileys Original Irish Cream Liqueur, 25ml brandy and 25ml crème de cacao into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain the mixture into a martini glass.
Using a grater, grate the side of a whole nutmeg onto the drink to garnish.

name: Rum Caipirinha
description: A delicious take on the classic Caipirinha cocktail, this Rum Caipirinha drink blends the rich, full flavour of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold rum with zinging lime and sugar.Evoking tropical getaways and the spirit of celebration, the Rum Caipirinha is one of the great party drinks.

instructions.description: Using a knife and chopping board, cut a lime into 4 wedges.Place the lime wedges and 1 tsp sugar into a tumbler.Press down on the lime wedges and sugar in a highball glass using a muddler to extract juices and flavour.
Top up the glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold into the glass.
Stir using a bar spoon until the mixture is well combined to complete your Caipirinha.

name: Bourbon & Cola
description: A version of the classic dark spirits with cola, in the form of the American spirit of choice Bourbon, the vanilla flavours in both combine beautifully for a fine mixed drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Bourbon into the glass. Top up with 125ml cola.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a lime wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Rum Espresso Martini
description: The classic Espresso Martini gains extra intensity from the rich, dark Caribbean flavour of Captain Morgan rum. With fresh-brewed espresso and coffee liqueur, it’s deliciously indulgent.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Captain Morgan Original Rum, 25ml coffee liqueur, 25ml sugar syrup and 25ml espresso into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled.Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass using a cocktail strainer.
Add 3 coffee beans to the top of the drink to garnish.

name: Bourbon & Ginger Ale
description: A great party drink, with a pour of ginger ale picking out the delicious, spicy wood notes of a quality base spirit in the form of Bourbon for a classy serve.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Bourbon into the glass. Top up with 125ml ginger ale.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a lime wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Rum Punch
description: Captain Morgan Original Rum and Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold provide a base of distinctive richness and mellow spice for this delicious drink with historic connections.Pair with lush tropical fruit flavours plus a hint of citrus for a fine, celebratory serve.

instructions.description: With a sharp knife and cutting board, slice wedges from any combination of orange, lemon, lime and pineapple and place in the punch bowl and add the cinnamon stick.

Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced, 25ml Captain Morgan Original Rum, 50ml apple juice, 20ml lemon juice, 15ml caramel syrup, 50ml ginger beer and 1 dash angostura bitters into the bowl and give it a stir.Adjust citrus juice and liqueurs so that the sweet–sour balance is to your liking.
Place the punch bowl in the fridge for 2–3 hours to chill before serving.
Using a ladle, scoop liquid and fruit into individual glasses, over ice cubes.Using a grater, grate ginger over individual drinks to garnish.

name: Bourbon & Soda
description: This simple mix is a surprising hit, with a zesty, clean pour of soda loosening the rich vanilla and clove flavours of tasty Bourbon for an impressive long drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Bourbon into the glass. Top up with 125ml soda.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a lime wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Rusty Nail
description: Combining Scotch whisky and Drambuie, the Rusty Nail is high up on the list of cocktails made with Scotch, and makes for a wonderfully indulgent blend of heather flavours, spices and sweet caramel.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blended Scotch Whisky and 25ml Drambuie into the glass.
With a bar spoon stir the mixture.With a strainer, strain into a short glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, slice a piece of lemon peel and place in glass to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cola
description: The classic combination that's drunk around the world, it highlights the subtly sweet vanilla and caramelised flavours common to both Captain Morgan Original Rum and cola.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml cola into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a wedge of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Cranberry Juice
description: A sharp, fruity cranberry tang adds a twist to the caramelised, vanilla flavours of Captain Morgan Original Rum for a great, simple-to-make drink that your guests will love.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml cranberry juice into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a wedge of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Savoury Eggnog
description: Have you heard about the Eggnog with a cheeky savoury twist? Well, if you like a Bloody Mary, you’ll love this creation.Combining Johnnie Walker Black with Egg and cream plus Worcestershire Sauce and celery salt make the Savoury Eggnog as warm and filling as it is delicious.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Black Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Wipe the rim of a tumbler glass with lemon and celery salt,Place all ingredients in a shaker, shake, add ice, shake and shake again, add ice to glass and pour.Fill the glass ½ of the way with ice cubes.Strain into a glass.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Ginger Beer
description: Mix this pub classic at home whenever you have the opportunity, combining classic dark rum flavours of Captain Morgan with sweet, dry hoppy beer and spicy ginger.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml ginger beer into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Classic Old Fashioned
description: Arguably the world's oldest cocktail, the Old-Fashioned is a deceptively simple blend of whiskey, sugar and bitters, and a must for any lover of dark spirits seeking perfection in a glass.

instructions.description: Add 1 bar spoon of sugar into a mixing glass. Add 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters. Add 50ml of Bulleit Bourbon whiskey.
Garnish with an orange peel.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Lemonade
description: This easy-to-make combination uses lemonade to lighten both look and taste for a fresh, sparkling long drink, subtly picking out the great tastes of Captain Morgan Original Rum.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml lemonade into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a wedge of lemon and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Orange Juice
description: A simple mix of fresh orange juice with tasty dark Captain Morgan Original Rum makes this a versatile combination for any occasion – on your own or when with friends.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml orange juice into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of orange and place on top of the drink to garnish.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.DRINKS CALCULATOR

name: Singapore Sling
description: Sweet, rich cherry brandy cut through by zesty citrus and finished with delicious gin botanicals: the Singapore Sling is one of the great cocktails, although arguments over its exact recipe exist.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 25ml of London Dry Gin, 25ml cherry brandy, 5ml of benedictine, 25ml of lemon juice and 10ml of grenadine into a cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a tall glass.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum & Pineapple Juice
description: Add a tropical touch with a pour of pineapple juice that picks up on the Caribbean connections of Captain Morgan Original Rum for a delicious mixed drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Rum and 125ml pineapple juice into the glass.

name: Slim Santa
description: Believe it or not, yes this is a Slim Santa – all ready to be poured into your glass.Santa’s been working out, running around getting your presents ready, and the Slim Santa is the result – a combination of vodka, lemonade and pomegranate that’s the colour of Christmas. You’ll be red-y to serve this delicious cocktail in an instant.

instructions.description: Fill a red Burgundy wine glass with ice cubes.

Add pomegranate seeds and the pomegranate juice.Scatter over 6 pomegranate seeds and add 35ml pomegranate juice.Add 25ml vodka.Add 140ml lemonade, or enough to fill the glass.PRO: Add a sprig of rosemary inside: the savoury notes will shine within the deep red hue of the drink.

name: Captain Morgan Original Rum Mai Tai
description: The ultimate Tiki drink, a tangy, refreshing blend of dark rum and tropical fruit, the Mai Tai is Hawaii in a glass. Ideally, of course, in a Tiki glass.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 35ml Captain Morgan Original Rum, 10ml Orange Liqueur, 25ml lime juice, 10ml orgeat and 50ml pineapple juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a strainer strain the cocktail into a tall glass over ice cubes.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut an orange wedge and place in the drink to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Cola
description: There's a reason why this simple combination is such a classic: it's the flavour match of vanilla and caramel in both the cola mixer and Captain Morgan, here with an extra, spicy twist.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml cola into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Diet Lemonade
description: Low in calories, but with a light zestiness, the lemonade highlights the spicy flavour of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold for great easy drinking on the patio or in the home.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml diet lemonade into the glass.
Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a wedge of lemon and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Slojito
description: A version of the modern classic Mojito cocktail, this swaps in London Dry Gin and basil for the traditional rum and mint combination that leaves a great lingering taste.

instructions.description: Press down on 10 basil leaves and a teaspoon of brown sugar with a muddler to extract the juices and flavour in a cocktail shaker.
Use a jigger to measure 50ml Sloe Gin and add ice cubes to the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Pour the mixture into a tall glass.Top up the drink with a splash of soda water.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Ginger Ale
description: A double dose of delicious spice that fills the palate, with sweet caramel and vanilla flavours in Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold balanced by a pour of dry ginger ale.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml ginger ale into the glass.
Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Lemonade
description: A simple mix of fizzing mixer and spicy base spirit, this drink is easy to make but a really tasty combination that’s great for sharing with friends and family.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml lemonade into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a wedge of lemon and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka & Apple Juice
description: A simple and tasty aperitif, vodka and apple juice is an elegant, tart mixed drink that can be garnished with a slice of apple for extra effect.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and 125ml apple juice. Pour into a tall glass over ice cubes.
Using a sharp knife cut a slice of apple on a chopping board, drop into glass and serve.

name: Vodka & Bitter Lemon
description: A tangy lemon kick from the bitter lemon mixer complements the clean, smooth base spirit of vodka. It’s sweet, tasty and makes for a great aperitif serve.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and 125ml bitter lemon and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge for a garnish. Squeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold & Orange Juice
description: A pour of the citrus fruit mixer makes for a lighter coloured but spicy orange drink that tastes like Christmas but can be enjoyed by you and friends any time of the year.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml orange juice into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of orange and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka & Cola
description: A classic mixture of two iconic drinks, this adds sweetness to the clean, sharp flavours of vodka for a great serve. It also happens to be one of the world's most popular drinks.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka into the glass. Top up with 125ml cola.
With a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka & Cranberry Juice (New Yorker)
description: Officially called a Cape Codder, this simple mixture is effortless to make but tastes great, with a tangy, fruity edge to the smoothness of vodka, that’s ideal for parties. We've used Smirnoff here. but you can level up this simple cocktail by using one of the amazing flavoured vodkas from the  CÎROC range

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes. Top with 125ml cranberry juice.
Using a sharp knife, cut a wedge of fresh lime on a chopping board. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold Apple
description: A delicious take on the autumnal dish of spiced apple that takes Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, adds a pour of apple juice and ends up with a great long drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and 125ml apple juice into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of apple and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka & Diet Cola
description: A classic and easy-to-make drink that’s simple and tasty, this has a cola taste that complements the clean vodka finish. One of the world's most popular mixes, this version is also low in calories.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with 125ml diet cola.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for a garnish. Squeeze wedge, then drop into glass and serve.

name: Clove Bitters
description: Clove bitters adds aromatic spice, and is the ultimate component to the deliciously festive London Dry Gin and Clove cooler.

instructions.description: In a container, add the gin, then the cloves, seal from air, leave for as long as possible (min 24hrs).

name: Vodka & Ginger Ale
description: The sweet ginger flavour adds an extra layer to the smooth, clean taste of vodka. Ideal for a summer’s evening, it also works in winter thanks to the warming flavours.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes. Top up with 125ml ginger ale.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Vodka & Grapefruit Juice (Greyhound)
description: The Greyhound is a tangy, citrus-edged combination of vodka and grapefruit juice that has evolved over time into a great drink.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass over cubed ice. Top up with 125ml of grapefruit juice.
Using a sharp knife, cut a wedge of fresh lemon on a chopping board. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Vodka & Lemonade
description: One of the world's favourite drinks, vodka and lemonade is an easy to mix crowd pleaser. Shake things up with flavoured vodkas for a totally new experience. If you have a sweet tooth we recommend Smirnoff Vanilla for a deliciously sweet but light tasting drink. Or for a fruity twist try the new Mango & Passionfruit Twist or Raspberry Crush flavours. Both make for excellent summer drinking!

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with 125ml lemonade.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Vodka & Pineapple Juice
description: A hint of tropical flavour with the smooth, clean flavour of vodka, make this a perfect holiday reminder, or for drinking with friends when you have them over.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka into the glass. Top up with 125ml pineapple juice.
With a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Vodka & Soda
description: The mix of soda and vodka is one of the most popular worldwide. Pour in a long glass with a slice of lime for a delicious, simple serve.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass over cubed ice. Top up with 125ml soda water.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Bay Breeze
description: A delicious, sweet-tart balance of pineapple and cranberry over a vodka base, the Bay Breeze is the less famous, but more exotic variant of the classic summer cocktail, the Sea Breeze.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka, 80ml pineapple juice and 25ml cranberry juice into the glass.

name: Ghouls’ Goblet
description: This spooky serve will cast the perfect spell with its sweet and sour sensations. Just don’t be alarmed when you see some creepy creatures at the bottom of your glass!

instructions.description: Place 12 gummy worm sweets, or one per space, in an ice tray. Top each with water.Carefully place 1 to 2 drops of food colouring around each gummy worm sweet, with one colour per space for a varied effect.
Add 2–3 gummy worm sweet ice cubes to a tumbler glass. Pour vodka and top with ginger ale.
Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut wheels of lemon and orange and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Harvey Wallbanger
description: A long, citrusy cocktail with subtle herbal flavours, the Harvey Wallbanger was reputedly named after a Manhattan Beach surfer, and has gone on to become a modern classic.

instructions.description: Fill a Collins glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka, 17.5ml vanilla liqueur and 100ml orange juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut an orange slice and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Kiwi Collins
description: The addition of kiwi fruit to this version of the Joe Collins gives a sweet and sour twist that complements the smooth flavour of vodka in an unusual but delicious way.

instructions.description: Cut kiwi in half, scoop out kiwi with a bar spoon into cocktail shaker and muddle.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml of vodka, 35ml of freshly squeezed lemon juice and 10ml of sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain the mixture into a Collins glass with a cocktail strainer. Top up with carbonated water

name: Long Vodka
description: The lime and bitters make for a tasty, sweet-sour version of the classic vodka and lemonade, adding zesty citrus flavours to lift the drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka and 100ml lemonade into the glass. Add a couple of dashes of angostura bitters.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a lime in half and squeeze some of the juice into the drink.

name: Madras
description: Colourful, fruity and refreshing, the Madras is a sharper, more citrussy version of its close relative, the Cosmopolitan.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka and 50ml cranberry juice into a tall glass over ice cubes and stir well. Top up with 50ml orange juice.
Stir the mixture thoroughly with a bar spoon.

name: Marmalade Collins
description: A delicious mix of zesty flavours, the Marmalade Collins is also one of the easiest cocktails you’ll ever make. In just under 60 seconds you can blend pure, clear vodka with sweet and sour in a jam jar for a great serve. Lay out the ingredients & jam jars and get your guests to serve themselves. Entertainment, sorted!

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka, 25ml lemon juice, 1 tsp caster sugar and 1 tsp marmalade into a jam jar.
Fill the rest of the jam jar with ice cubes.
Screw the lid tightly onto the jam jar and shake the mixture until the surface of the jam jar feels chilled.Unscrew the lid of the jam jar and top with a little more ice and some soda water.
Using a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a wedge of lemon and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Cosmopolitan
description: There are some – a very few – cocktails that define a decade. And the Cosmopolitan, a hot pink, pleasantly sharp cocktail served in the iconic martini glass, was the essence of the 1990s. Here's our perfect version.

instructions.description: Fill your shaker 3/4 full with cubed ice.
Add vodka, orange liqueur, lime and Cranberry juice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously for 10 seconds until cold.
Strain into a martini glass and garnish with the orange zest.

name: Dill or No Dill
description: The Dill Or No Dill was created especially for the World Class 50 by World Class UK finalist and London-based mixologist Gareth Evans. It’s a highly innovative cocktail with a perfect sweet and sour balance using the fresh fruit and botanicals in Tanqueray 10 as a base.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin into the shaker. Pour 25ml lemon juice, 17.5ml elderflower syrup and 20ml cucumber water into the shaker. Add a sprig of dill and a pinch of smoked salt.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a martini or highball glass.
Place a sprig of dill onto the side of the glass to garnish.

name: Raspberry Collins
description: A light and fruity blend of vodka, fresh lemon juice, sweet sugar and muddled strawberries, this impressive-looking drink is ideal for summer parties with friends.

instructions.description: Muddle 8 raspberries in the base of a shaker. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka, 25ml lemon juice and 10ml sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain the mixture into a Collins glass filled with ice with a cocktail strainer.
Top up with carbonated water and place 1 raspberry on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Screwdriver
description: This classic 1960s drink, comprising a perfect pairing of vodka and fresh orange juice served over plenty of ice, is back in vogue today thanks in part to US TV hit series Mad Men.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml vodka into the glass. Top up with 125ml orange juice.
With a sharp knife, cut a wedge of fresh orange on a chopping board to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Sea Breeze
description: A crisp, refreshing blend of vodka, cranberry and grapefruit, served long over plenty of ice, the Sea Breeze is a simple, timeless cocktail that is redolent of bright summer days.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka, 50ml grapefruit juice and 50ml cranberry juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a wedge of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Frozen Mary
description: Freeze! Stop right there and mix up your Frozen Mary cocktail. It’s a delicious blend of bold, spicy flavours with vodka, tomato juice, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco plus plenty of ice all whizzed up. Yes, you can chill out with a little heat!

instructions.description: Take a sharp knife and chopping board and cut 1 lemon in half. Half fill a blender with ice.
Add 50ml vodka, 120ml tomato juice, the juice of half a lemon, 4 dashes of Tabasco sauce, 4 dashes of Worcestershire sauce and 2 grinds of black pepper into the blender.
Switch on the blender and blend all the ingredients until combined.
Pour into a glass. Place a stalk of celery in the drink. Take a slice of lemon and slot onto the edge of the glass.

name: Dirty Martini
description: Like so many classic cocktails, the Martini has a long history riddled with more fiction than fact, but the Dirty martini draws no arguments as to its method.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, carefully measure 50ml vodka, 10ml dry vermouth and 25ml olive brine into the shaker.
Using a bar spoon, stir until well combined.With a cocktail strainer, strain into a martini glass.
Place a black olive in the drink to garnish.

name: South Side
description: Essentially a Mojito with London Dry Gin instead of rum, this cocktail is named after one of Chicago's most famous districts, and packs a sweet-sour punch.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin, 25ml lemon juice and 12ml sugar syrup into the shaker.Add 8 mint leaves.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a martini glass.
Place 2 mint leaves on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Blanco Tequila & Cola
description: An unusual combination, but truly a delicious one, serve Blanco Tequila and cola with a squeeze of lime for a cool, refreshing mixed drink that your guests will love.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila and 125ml cola into the glass.
Cut a wedge of lime with a sharp knife on a chopping board and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Spiced Ice Tea
description: This is not a version of the classic Long Island Iced Tea – but a delicious, easy-to-mix combination of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold and iced tea that’s just as good.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
With a jigger measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, 125ml iced tea, 2 slices of lemon, a pinch of cinnamon and nutmeg into the glass.
Stir the mixture using a bar spoon until well combined.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a tall glass.

name: Erik Lorincz's One Night
description: With depth of flavour and perfect balance, One Night is a cocktail with credentials. It’s the creation of Erik Lorincz, head bartender at The American Bar at The Savoy and a former World Class Bartender of the Year.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 45ml Single Malt Whisky, 10ml Pimento Dram, 10ml lemon juice, 35ml sugar syrup and a dash of egg white into the shaker.
Shake the mixture until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain the mixture into a short glass.
Add a few drops of aromatic bitters on top of the drink, and spritz over some violet spray for garnish.

name: Spiced Mojito
description: A cool, crisp, summery blend of rum, mint, lime and soda – the Spiced Mojito is a version of the classic Cuban cocktail with a subtle piquancy thanks to a base of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold.

instructions.description: Place 7 mint leaves into a Collins glass.Using a knife cut a lime in two on a chopping board and place in the drink.With a jigger, measure 25ml sugar syrup into the glass.Using a muddler, rolling pin or large spoon, press down on the mint, lime and sugar to extract aroma and flavour.
Half-fill your glass with crushed ice.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold into the glass and top with soda water
Using a bar spoon, stir the mixture thoroughly. Add more crushed ice to fill the glass and place a mint sprig on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Baileys Flat White Martini
description: From coffee chains across the land comes the craze for the flat white, and we’ve captured it in cocktail form with the Flat White Martini. So create your very own coffee serve in the kitchen – just don’t charge your guests for a glass!

instructions.description: Add cubes of ice to a cocktail shaker.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream and 25ml espresso and 25ml vodka into the cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain the mixture into a martini glass.
Add three coffee beans on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Strawberry Daiquiri
description: Alongside the Cuba Libre and the Mojito, the Daiquiri is one of the three great Cuban cocktails, and by adding strawberries it gains texture and taste.

instructions.description: Fill your shaker 3/4 full with cubed ice.
Pour in Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, sugar syrup, fresh lime juice and 3 chopped strawberries.
Shake vigorously for 10 seconds until cold. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with a strawberry.

name: French 21
description: A version of the traditional French 75 cocktail, the French 21 combines vodka, lemon juice, raspberry liqueur and champagne for a striking celebratory cocktail.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 10ml vodka, 10ml lemon juice, 5ml raspberry liqueur and 5ml sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a champagne flute. Top up the drink with sparkling wine.
With a sharp knife and a chopping board, slice the peel off a lemon and twist it into the flute to garnish.

name: Strawberry Mojito
description: Cuba meets the English summertime in the Strawberry Mojito cocktail recipe; a drink where juicy fresh fruit squashed with zesty lime, white rum and a touch of fresh mint makes for a berry nice combination.

instructions.description: Press down on 2 wedges of lime, 3 strawberries and 2 teaspoons of caster sugar in a tankard or jar using a large spoon or pestle to extract flavour and aroma.Pick 12 leaves from a sprig of mint and place in the glass. Press down gently on the mint, together with the sugar, strawberries and lime.
Add crushed ice so the tumbler or tankard is ¾ full.
Pour in Captain Morgan® White Rum and a dash of soda water.Stir the mixture thoroughly using a bar spoon until well combined.
Top up with more crushed ice and garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: French 75
description: Lightly sparkling, citrusy, subtly sweet and tinged with delicious botanicals: the French 75 champagne cocktail is the invention of one of the greatest ever bartenders, who mixed gin, lemon juice, sugar syrup and champagne to great effect.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml London Dry Gin, 10ml lemon juice and 5ml sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a champagne flute and top up with champagne.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a strip of lemon peel and twist onto the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Cirocstar Martini
description: A gorgeous, easy-drinking fruit martini with lush pineapple, rich raspberry and grape vodka, the Cirocstar Martini is perfect for sharing with guests, offering a frothy top for extra effect.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 40ml vodka, 20ml raspberry liqueur and 50ml pineapple juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled.Strain the drink with a cocktail strainer into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a mint sprig

name: Frozen Banana Daiquiri
description: Bring on the bananas! The Frozen Banana Daiquiri cocktail is ripe for a revival with its delicious mix of clear, clean white rum, crushed ice and best of all – bananas.

instructions.description: Using a knife and chopping board, slice one ring from a whole banana, and cut a slit halfway through the diameter.Add 60ml Captain Morgan White Rum, 30ml banana liqueur, 15ml lime juice, the rest of the banana and cubes of ice into a blender.
Switch on the blender and combine the ingredients.Pour into a Hurricane glass.
Take the banana slice and slot onto on the edge of the glass.

name: Game, Set & Match by Ash Bovey
description: Inspired by Wimbledon fever, Ash has created a new drink that captures the spirit of this classic British event, with fresh, clean Smirnoff No. 21 Vodka and a sweet–sour mix of fresh strawberries plus cranberry juice.

instructions.description: Press down with a muddler on 3 strawberries to extract the juice and the flavour.Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka and 20ml vanilla syrup into the glass.
Fill the glass with crushed ice, and stir the drink with a bar spoon.Top up the glass with 150ml cranberry juice.
Place 2 strawberries on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Summer Blossom
description: Floral with a hint of fruit and bergamot – that’s Summer Blossom, full of the hopes and flavours of the early warm months.Enjoy gin with a spot of elderflower mixed with cloudy apple juice and syrup made from Earl Grey tea to conjure up this quirky mix of tea time, apple orchards and blooming elderflower, all in one glass.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 40ml gin with a spot of elderflower, 20ml Sauvignon Blanc, 20ml cloudy apple juice and 15ml Earl Grey syrup into the shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled.Strain the liquid into a Coupe glass through both a cocktail strainer and sieve. This is to remove any trace of ice or solids, and is a technique known as ‘double straining’.
Place a sprig of elderflower on top of the drink to garnish.

tags.name: Gin With A Spot Of Elderflower

name: Pippa's Ultimate G&T
description: Less is more and there is nothing simpler than a classic Gin &Tonic, Pippa style. Her suggestion? Use only best the ingredients  for the ultimate G&T.

instructions.description: In a frozen Copa glass, add gin and fill the glass with ice. The larger the cubes are, the better. Squeeze in one of the lime wedges.
Add the tonic (if you run it down the stem of a bar spoon, it will help retain the effervescence). Squeeze in the second lime wedge, briefly stir. Now put your feet up and enjoy.

name: Bramble
description: Created by bartender Dick Bradsell in 1984 at Fred’s Club in Soho, London, this cocktail with the unusual addition of blackberry has become a modern classic.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 35ml London Dry Gin, 25ml lemon juice and 10ml sugar syrup into the shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a tall glass filled with crushed ice. Pour 10ml crème de mure over the mixture.
With a sharp knife cut a strip of peel off the lemon on a chopping board and twist into the glass to garnish.

name: Mandarin & Clove Cooler
description: We all know the best spreads include an aperitif. Try out our unique Mandarin & Clove Cooler, the perfect cocktail to enjoy with food and friends.

instructions.description: a. Add all ingredients except the bitter lemonb. Fill with icec. Seal and shaked. Strain into a tall glass over icee. Top with Bitter Lemon Clove bitters
a. Build all ingredients over ice except bitter lemonb. Stir and lengthen drinkc. Top with bitter lemon d. Garnish with dried mandarin

name: Tom Collins
description: Gin botanicals, citrus fruit sweetness and a touch of sourness, bubbled up with soda water – the Tom Collins is one of the simplest long drinks, such a classic that it’s had a glass named after it.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin, 25ml lemon juice, 10ml sugar syrup into the glass.
Stir the mixture with a bar spoon until the ingredients are well combined.Top up the drink with a splash of soda water.
With a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a wedge of lemon and place into the drink to garnish.

name: Gin Mojito
description: A gin-based version of the classic Mojito, switching out rum for London Dry Gin and apple instead of mint for a subtle take on the great cocktail

instructions.description: Clap the mint in you palms to releases the aromas and place at the bottom of the tall glass. Chop your half lime into pieces and place on top of the mint.Add your sugar or sugar syrup on top of the mint and lime. Muddle gently to release the lime juices.
Fill your glass 3/4 full with crushed ice (important to use crushed ice to ensure maximum flavour).
Pour in London Dry Gin and apple juice.
Stir everything together well and top with further crushed ice and garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Gin Punch
description: Take the delicious botanicals of London Dry Gin and build a fruit punch that makes the most of this premium spirit. The subtle grapefruit hints are heightened by an array of tasty fruit juices, making a lavish punch that’s perfect for celebrating.

instructions.description: Place selected fruits in a bowl.With a sharp knife and cutting board, slice wedges from any combination of orange, lemon, lime and pineapple and place in a punch bowl.Add 1.5 bottles London Dry Gin into the bowl. Add the remaining ingredients.

Using a jigger, measure 350ml maraschino liqueur, 500ml apricot nectar, 500ml orange juice, 1l pineapple juice, 200ml lime juice and 100ml sugar syrup into the bowl.Adjust sweet–sour balance of citrus juice and liqueurs so that it is to your liking.Place the punch bowl in the fridge for 2–3 hours to chill before serving.
Using a ladle, scoop liquid and fruit into individual glasses, over ice cubes.Top up with sparkling wine.

name: Tequila Mojito
description: Mexico meets Cuba in this twist on the classic Mojito. With tequila in place of rum, it's a bold addition to the mint, lime, sugar and soda. Serve these at parties, mixed in a punch bowl.

instructions.description: Press down on 9 mint leaves in a cocktail shaker using a muddler to extract juices and flavour.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Blanco Tequila, 50ml lime juice, 110ml lemon juice and 50ml water into the shaker. Add ice cubes.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Fill a tall glass with crushed ice.Strain the mixture into the glass with a cocktail strainer.

name: Tequila Pina Colada
description: A play on the ultimate Tiki drink, the Tequila Pina Colada replaces rum with tequila, but keeps the pineapple and coconut for a burst of flavour that’s richly evocative and tropical in feel. Swap it back & keep quantities the same for the classic.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila, 50ml coconut cream and 110ml pineapple juice into a blender.
Blend the ingredients together until smooth.
Half-fill a Snifter glass with ice cubes. Pour the mixture from the blender into the glass.
Cut a slice of pineapple with a sharp knife on a cutting board and slot over the side of the glass to garnish.

name: Tequila Sunrise
description: Clean, pure blanco tequila with sweet grenadine and delicious, subtly sour orange juice makes one of the greatest of modern classic cocktails, a drink that has a surprising place in rock ‘n’ roll history.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Blanco Tequila, 110ml orange juice and 10ml cranberry juice into the glass.
Cut a wedge of orange with a sharp knife on a cutting board and place on top of the drink to garnish your Tequila Sunrise.

name: Gin Rickey
description: The Gin Rickey is a Tom Collins with lime rather than lemon, plus minimal sugar syrup, creating a citrusy mixed drink that shows off the great botanicals of London Dry Gin.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml London Dry Gin, 25ml lime juice and 10ml sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a tall glass.Top up with 100ml soda water.
Use a chopping board and sharp knife to cut a lime wedge and place on top of drink to garnish.

name: Glitterball
description: Subtly sweet, tangily sour and with a delicious edge of elderflower, the Glitterball is an enticingly flavoured cocktail, served in a champagne flute, that’s perfect for celebrating.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, measure 40ml Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve, 20ml elderflower cordial and 15ml sour syrup into the shaker.
Using a barspoon, stir the ingredients together for 20 seconds, until fully combined.Strain the mixture into a champagne glass using a cocktail strainer.Add 30ml soda water to top up.
Using a vegetable peeler, cut a twist of orange peel, and curl onto the top of the glass.

name: The Apple Bite
