description: Clean, pure vodka is mixed with rich apple, sparkling lemonade and zesty lime for a drink that grabs you. Serve with friends for a great start to the evening.

instructions.description: Fill a highball glass or silver mug with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml vodka into the glass. Add 100ml apple juice and 100ml lemonade into the glass and stir with a bar spoon.
With a sharp knife and cutting board, slice a lime wedge. Squeeze the wedge into the drink and then place into the glass.

name: The Birthday Cake
description: Based on rich, creamy, original Baileys that’s topped with whipped cream and sprinkled with hundreds-and-thousands, The Birthday Cake cocktail recipe tastes is simple to create and delicious. Make a wish as you take a sip!

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream into a shot glass.
Using a fork or beater, whip double cream until it forms peaks.Add 1 tbsp whipped cream to the glass.Scatter with 1 tbsp hundreds-and-thousands candy sprinkles.

name: Gin & Apple Juice
description: Adding apple juice is a great complement to the classic botanical flavours of London Dry Gin, making an elegant, tart mixed drink that goes down a treat.

instructions.description: Pour London Dry Gin and apple juice into a tall glass filled with ice cubes.
Top up with 125ml apple juice.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: The Elderflower G&T
description: Effectively a G&T plus elderflower cordial, the elderflower adds a delicious floral edge to the range of botanicals in London Dry Gin, making one of the great versions of the classic drink.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice.
Pour London Dry Gin, elderflower cordial and tonic water into the glass.
To serve squeeze the lime over the drink and drop it in.

name: Gin & Bitter Lemon
description: A touch of zesty citrus flavour complements the citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin. Create a great afternoon drink with friends with a few, simple pours.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin and 125ml bitter lemon. Pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Gin & Ginger Ale
description: Add ginger ale to London Dry Gin for an easy-to-make, delicious spicy and subtly sweet mixed drink to have when you’re relaxing or with friends.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin and pour into a tall glass filled with ice.Top up with 125ml ginger ale or more to your taste.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a wedge of lime for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: The Golden Flip by Theodoros Pirillos
description: The Golden Flip melds together Greek wildflower honey and tahini-infused Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve with apricot brandy and a spritz of orange zest for a richly impressive serve.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml tahini-infused Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve, 15ml Lillet Blanc, 15ml homemade honey syrup, 2 dashes Bergamot bitters, 2 dashes apricot brandy and 1 whole egg into a cocktail shaker.Place a small whisk in the shaker and dry shake all ingredients until well combined.
Remove the whisk and fill the cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer and a sieve, double strain into a goblet glass.
With a sharp knife and a chopping board, cut a piece of orange peel and twist it over the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: The Long Shot
description: Subtly sweet, bursting with fresh mint and citrus and based on delicious, vanilla-wood flavoured Bourbon plus pale ale, The Long Shot is the ideal cocktail recipe to partner great sport.

instructions.description: Add ice cubes to a cocktail shaker.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Bourbon, 12.5ml lemon juice and 2 tbsp sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain with a cocktail strainer into a Tankard over ice cubes.Add Pale Ale to the drink until it reaches the top of the glass.
Place a sprig of mint on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Gin & Grapefruit Juice
description: The sweet tartness of grapefruit juice combines with the citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin for a fruity, zesty drink that’s perfect for relaxing at home or with friends.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin into the glass.Top up with 125ml grapefruit juice.

name: Gin & Lemonade
description: An increasingly popular variation on the G&T, the addition of lemonade makes for a light, spritzy drink that’s easy to mix and delicious, a great, simple serve.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes. Top up with 125ml lemonade.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Gin & Orange Juice
description: Also known as Gin and Juice, this simple-to-make, popular drink switches in orange juice for the more commonly used soda for a tasty mix that is incredibly easy to make.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes. Top up with 125ml orange juice.
Use a chopping board and a sharp knife to cut an orange slice or a twist. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.DRINKS CALCULATOR

name: The Mint Oreo Shake by Sarah Mitchell
description: A creamy, chocolaty mix of classic Oreo cookies that’s perfectly blended with milk, vanilla ice cream, mint and vodka. This homage to the traditional milkshake was inspired by that old school American diner feel.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka into a blender, along with 3 Oreo cookies, 2 scoops vanilla ice cream, and blend until well combined.
Pour the mixture into a sundae glass.
Crush an Oreo cookie and scatter on top of the drink.Place a sprig of mint at angle against the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Gin & Pineapple Juice
description: This easy-to-make mix with pineapple juice makes for a great party drink with friends, and gives a tropical touch to the subtle citrus botanicals in London Dry Gin.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin and pour into a tall glass over ice cubes. Top up with 125ml pineapple juice.
Use a chopping board and a sharp knife to cut a lemon wedge. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.
Get some grub in before or while you’re drinking – it slows alcohol absorption.DRINKS CALCULATOR

name: The OMG&T
description: Perfect after work, this quintessentially British drink has been given a fresh berry facelift that'll wow your friends and take you straight to cocktail Nirvana.

instructions.description: Add gin, elderflower & berries to a jam jar filled with ice.
Shake vigorously to infuse the flavours and squeeze lime over the top.
Add contents to a tall glass & top with tonic. OMG!

name: Gin & Tomato Juice
description: This is a ‘Red Snapper' without the spices, a tasty blend of London Dry Gin and tomato juice that delivers texture and flavour in a couple of simple pours.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes
Using a jigger, measure 50ml London Dry Gin into the glass. Top up with 125ml tomato juice.

name: Frozen Gimlet
description: Gimme, gimme…the Frozen Gimlet, a delicious fusion of lime with blueberries, mint, crushed ice and gin that delivers fabulous fresh fruit flavour.

instructions.description: Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a lime in two.Add a scoopful of ice into a blender. Add 50ml of gin, 6 blueberries, the juice of half a lime, 6 mint leaves, and 1 teaspoon of sugar into the blender.
Switch on the blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into a tall glass.

name: Espresso Martini
description: A blend of vodka espresso, fresh-brewed espresso coffee, honey and Baileys Coffee, the Espresso Martini is a very modern drink based on an old classic, with a clean clear delivery of vodka, rich creamy flavours and a touch of delicious bitterness.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.

Using a jigger, measure 25ml Espresso Flavoured Vodka, 25ml Baileys with a hint of Coffee Flavour, 25ml espresso coffee and 10ml honey into the shaker.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a large martini glass.
Add 3 coffee beans to the top of the drink to garnish.

name: Sloe Gin & Lemonade
description: A twist on the popular modern classic of London Dry Gin and lemonade, the delicious fruit flavour of sloe berries is lengthened by the bubbly mixer.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Sloe Gin and pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with 125ml lemonade.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lemon wedge as a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: The Moscow Mule by John G. Martin
description: Originally made using Smirnoff No. 21 Vodka, this simple mix of spice and citrus is one of the classics. Created by John G Martin and his bar owner friend Jack Morgan, it sparked the cocktail revolution in the 1950’s.

instructions.description: Fill a highball glass or copper cup with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka, 17.5ml lime juice, 120ml ginger beer and one dash of bitters into the glass.
Stir the mixture until well combined.
With a sharp knife and cutting board, slice a wedge of lime and place in the drink to garnish.

name: Sloe Gin & Orange Juice
description: The classic Gin and Juice recipe is given extra fruitiness with Sloe Gin, resulting in a mini-fruit burst of contrasting but well-matched flavours.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Sloe Gin into the glass. Top up with 125ml orange juice.
With a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut an orange slice or twist to place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Sloe Gin & Tonic
description: A twist on the classic G&T, Sloe Gin adds a lip-smacking twist from fresh-picked sloe berries to the subtle zestiness of the tonic that’s autumnal in feel.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml Sloe Gin and pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with 125ml tonic.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for a garnish. Squeeze and drop into glass and serve.

name: Grapefruit Smash
description: A delicious bittersweet marmalade with pure, clear vodka and a lively dash of citrus makes a perfect fruit smash – and you can use the marmalade jar to serve it in.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka, 50ml Lemon Juice, and marmalade into the glass or jar.
Fill a highball glass or jam jar with crushed ice.
Stir with a bar spoon until the mixture is well combined.With a jigger, measure 25ml grapefruit juice into the glass. Top up with 100ml cloudy lemonade.
With a sharp knife cut a slice of lemon on a chopping board, and place in the drink. Add 1 mint leaf to finish the garnish.

name: Grog
description: What's in a name? 'Grog' may be the worst title for a cocktail ever, but with delicious spiced rum, lime juice and honey, it's surely one of the best tasting. So open your guests’ minds – and mouths – to a surprisingly delicious drink (and just tell them it's a punch).

instructions.description: Add ice cubes to a cocktail shaker.

Scoop runny honey from a jar into the shaker. Add Captain Morgan Original Spiced, lime juice and Angostura bitters.Using a bar spoon, scoop out a full spoon of runny honey and place in a cocktail shaker, along with 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced, 15ml lime juice and 2 dashes Angostura bitters.
Shake the mixture until the shaker feels cold.
Pour the liquid through a cocktail strainer into a Rocks glass.Using a sharp knife, cut a slice of lemon and place on the glass rim to garnish.

name: Hot Toddy
description: Get the hip flask in your bag: you can share the warmth around with a well-made Hot Toddy drink at your next party. It’s the ultimate cold-weather drink, bringing you and your friends together.

instructions.description: Place a bar spoon filled with runny honey in a tumbler or latte glass. Using a jigger, pour Single Malt Whisky, 17.5ml lemon juice and 3 cloves into the glass. Top up with boiling water.
Stir the liquid slowly using a bar spoon.
Use a sharp knife to cut a wedge of lemon on a chopping board and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Hurricane
description: A spiced version of the great Hurricane cocktail, this adds a spicy touch to the zesty, fruit-flavoured cocktail that's a great party serve – and an impressive one too.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 25ml Captain Morgan Original Rum, 25ml lime juice, 10ml passion fruit yellow syrup and 50ml pineapple juice into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain the cocktail into a tall glass over ice cubes.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut an orange wedge and place in the drink to garnish.

name: The Perfect Ten
description: A recipe that's made for gin, the perfect way to serve this super-premium gin and experience the delicious, whole fruit botanicals.

instructions.description: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml gin, into a cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a martini glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a long piece of peel from a grapefruit, twist and place it over the edge of the glass to garnish.

name: Jamaica Sunrise
description: This cocktail is the classic Screwdriver plus grenadine, the dark red liqueur adding colour and tart sweet flavour to the orange-tinged clean purity of vodka.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml vodka, 100ml orange juice and 10ml grenadine.
Stir together with a bar spoon to mix the ingredients thoroughly.

name: Jan Collins by Jeff Bell
description: A modern day twist on the all-American Tom Collins, the effervescent Jan Collins uses the crisp and sophisticated tasting Ketel One vodka in place of gin. The addition of the zesty orange and lemon citrus notes in the Ketel One produce a fresh tasting cocktail fizzing with flavour. Jan Collins was created by Jeff Bell for World Class 50, the definitive guide to fine drinking.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 45ml vodka, 25ml lemon juice, 15ml orange liqueur and 15ml sugar syrup into the shaker.

Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Strain the drink with a cocktail strainer into a Collins glass filled with crushed ice.Pour in 30ml soda water to top up.
Add a brandied cherry into the drink to garnish.

name: The Princess & the Pirate
description: A rich, creamy chocolate and subtly spicy blend of Baileys and Captain Morgan Spiced, The Princess & The Pirate is a delicious pairing of two very different characters! Enjoy with whipped cream and chocolate sprinkles for a real treat.

instructions.description: Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Baileys Original Irish Cream and 25ml Captain Morgan Spiced into the cocktail shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain the mixture into a tumbler.
Using a fork or beater, whip double cream until it forms peaks. Add 1 tbsp whipped cream to the glass. Scatter with 1bsp chocolate sprinkles to finish.

name: The Russian Iced Tea by Emma Sherwood-Smith
description: A zesty, cooling serve of vodka, lemon iced tea and apple juice. The Russian Iced Tea is made in a teapot for a twist on the traditional serve.

instructions.description: Half fill a teapot with cubes of ice.
Using a jigger, pour 100ml vodka, 200ml lemon iced tea and 200ml apple juice into the teapot.
Stir the mixture with a bar spoon until well combined. Pour the drink carefully into two teacups over ice. (This drink is best shared with friends)
With a sharp knife and cutting board, slice a wedge of lemon, and place in the drink. Add a sprig of mint against the rim of the cup to garnish.

name: Jimmy Dean by Jenner Cormier
description: A whisky cocktail that’s drawn from a forest landscape, Jimmy Dean by Jenner Cormier has the deep, rich, smooth flavours of Johnnie Walker® Blue Label plus delicious homemade pear oak bitters and smoked wood for a taste of the wilds.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Platinum Blended Scotch Whisky
Johnnie Walker® Blue Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 1 dash pear oak bitters, 20ml Lillet Blanc, 10ml Johnnie Walker Platinum Label Whisky, and 45ml Johnnie Walker Blue Label Whisky into a cocktail shaker.
Add cubes of ice to the shaker and stir thoroughly using a bar spoon until well combined.Strain with a cocktail strainer into a tumbler.
Fill a small bowl with a sprig of spruce, a sprig of rosemary and a handful of hickory chips, and set alight with a match or blowtorch. Present alongside the tumbler containing the drink.

name: White Chocolate Martini
description: One of the more striking versions of the classic martini, the Chocolate Martini uses white chocolate liqueur for a striking-looking drink and rich, cocoa-butter flavours that blend beautifully with the subtle honey of vodka.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 20ml vodka, 20ml white chocolate liqueur and 17.5ml white crème de cacao liqueur into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled. Strain the mixture using a cocktail strainer, into a martini glass.

name: John 'N' Pickle
description: Why not put a twist on an Old Fashioned with the John 'n' Pickle! With hints of chutney, this cocktail is the perfect accompaniment to an after-dinner cheeseboard.

instructions.description: In a glass, add the chutney, 50 ml Johnnie Walker Black and the Demerara Sugar Syrup.
Then add two ice cubes.
Stir until ice is half melted. Add the rest of the ingredients. Add more ice and stir until mixed.

name: Vesper Martini
description: A creation of James Bond author Ian Fleming, this classy, sweet and sour cocktail is on every bartender’s repertoire, ordered by those in the know, and made as fine variation on the martini.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 35ml London Dry Gin, 10ml vodka and 10ml dry vermouth into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled. Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a martini glass.
With a sharp knife slice the peel from a lemon on a chopping board and twist over the rim of the glass to garnish.

name: Vodka & Orange Juice
description: Combine zesty orange juice with cool, crisp vodka for a delicious version of one of the best-known mixed drinks.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml vodka into a tall glass. Top up with 125ml orange juice.
With a sharp knife, cut a wedge of a fresh orange on a chopping board and place in drink to garnish.

name: Vodka Martini
description: Bone-dry, crystal clear and icy cold, the martini cocktail is the ultimate classic cocktail, enjoyed by everyone from Clark Gable and Bette Davis to Audrey Hepburn and the Rat Pack.

instructions.description: Fill your shaker 3/4 full with cubed ice.
Pour vodka and vermouth over the ice into the shaker.
Shake vigorously for 10 seconds until cold. Strain into the martini glass.
To serve, add the lemon zest.

name: Johnnie Walker Black Label & Ginger Ale
description: A fresh take on a whisky cocktail is this Johnnie Ginger by Tim Philips-Johansson. This wily creation merges those smoky, spicy, fruity aromas of the Johnnie Walker Black with the sweet, sparkling flare of Ginger Ale.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Black Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Black Label Whisky and 150ml ginger ale into the glass.

name: Vodka Tonic
description: One of the classic combinations, but light in calories, it's simple, light texture and flavour makes it the perfect aperitif or drink with friends, and it mixes well in various measures.

instructions.description: Use a jigger to measure 50ml vodka and pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with 125ml tonic.
Using a chopping board and a sharp knife, cut a lime wedge for a garnish. Squeeze wedge, then drop into glass and serve.

name: Johnnie Walker Black Label the Long Walker
description: Ginger and apple flavours deliciously complement a pour of Johnnie Walker Black Label by adding spicy and gently sweet notes, and making this one of the finest long drinks you’ll savour.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Black Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Black Label Whisky, 50ml ginger ale and 25ml apple juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a slice of lime to place in the drink to garnish.

name: Whiskey Sour
description: Rounded, soft, oaky notes are cut through with lemony citrus in this classic old-timer: the Whiskey Sour is a rye whiskey or bourbon-based version of one of the world’s most famous cocktails.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Use a jigger to measure 50ml Bourbon, 25ml lemon juice, 10ml sugar syrup and a dash of angostura bitters into the shaker. Add 2 egg whites.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled. Using a cocktail strainer, strain the cocktail into a short glass.
Use a sharp knife to cut a wedge of lemon on a chopping board and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Double Black Label & Soda
description: A pour of fizzing, sweet-sour soda is a delicious way to open out the intensely smoky, rich flavours of Johnnie Walker Double Black Label, creating a fine long drink for any occasion.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Double Black Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Double Black Label Whisky and 125ml soda into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Whisky & Ginger with Cranberry Juice
description: Add this sharp, fruity cranberry juice to a spicy blend with Johnnie Walker Red Label for a crowd-pleasing mixed drink that makes a great, simple cocktail.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Blended Scotch Whisky, 50ml ginger ale and 50ml cranberry juice into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Mango Crush
description: Enjoy Johnnie Walker whisky in a way you’ve probably never tried before. Serve with crushed ice, strawberries, blueberries, mango for a deliciously tropical take on the classic Scotch with the Mango Crush recipe.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Half fill a blender with ice.

Take a sharp knife and chopping board and cut up a mango into chunks.Add 25ml Johnnie Walker Red Label, 2 cups of chopped mango, a scoop of chopped strawberries, 1 tablespoon of blueberries, and 3 dashes of coconut water into the blender.
Switch on the blender and blend until smooth.Pour the contents of the blender into a tall glass.
Place 2 chopped strawberries and 3 blueberries on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Cola
description: Whisky and cola is one of the world's favourite combinations, and Johnnie Walker Red Label is an ideal blend with subtle flavours lifted by a pour of the mixer.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and 125ml cola into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Ginger Ale
description: A spicy lift to the perfect mixing whisky, the ginger highlights the subtle spice flavours among other great tastes in Johnnie Walker Red Label in this simple, mixed drink.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and 150ml ginger ale into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of lime and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Green Tea
description: The subtle tannins of green tea combine with Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky to accentuate the peaty richness and complexity of this outstanding blended Scotch. Serve to surprise and delight guests.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Blended Scotch Whisky into the glass and stir with a bar spoon.
Pour 100ml green tea into the glass to top up.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, slice a lemon wedge and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: White Russian
description: An easy-drinking blend of vodka, coffee liqueur and cream, the White Russian was a favourite during the glory days of disco. Today it is a hipster staple once again.

instructions.description: Fill an Old Fashioned glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, pour 50ml vodka and 25ml Baileys Coffee Irish Cream Liqueur into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Pour into a short glass.
Gently top up with 50ml cream and garnish with a sprinkle of chocolate shavings.

name: Woo Woo
description: With sour, crisp cranberry and sweet peach plus cool, clean vodka, the Woo Woo cocktail is a delicious concoction born of long, hot summers and a new wave of bartenders in the 1970s.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml peach schnapps and 25ml vodka into the glass.
Stir thoroughly using a bar spoon. Top up with 100ml cranberry juice.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Jasmine Tea
description: Made for mixing, Johnnie Walker Red Label Scotch Whisky is perfectly balanced with a pour of fruity, flower-hinted jasmine tea. The dark leaf notes add a base flavour alongside the complex peatiness that will impress your guests.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky into the glass and stir with a bar spoon.
Pour 100ml jasmine tea into the glass to top up.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, slice a lemon wedge and place on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Johnnie Walker Red Label & Orange
description: A great way to lengthen Johnnie Walker Red Label, the zesty, citrus tang of orange juice picks out subtle fruity flavours in the whisky in this simple drink. You could use any whiskey from your home bar to make this, but it works best with light, fruity Blended Scotch or Bourbon. We've recommended some alternatives below.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Pour Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and orange juice into the glass.
Using a jigger, measure 50ml Johnnie Walker Red Label Whisky and 125ml orange into the glass.
With a sharp knife and chopping board, cut a slice of orange peel and twist on top of the drink to garnish.

name: Zombie
description: Tropical, fruity and rum-based, the Zombie is one of the original Tiki cocktails. It’s a delicious punch that comes from a man by the name of Don the Beachcomber, who created a new craze for carved mugs and hula fashion.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with cubes of ice.

Using a jigger, measure 50ml Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, 25ml Captain Morgan Original Rum, 15ml Orange Liqueur, 15ml apricot brandy, 50ml orange juice, 25ml pineapple juice, 25ml lime juice and 15ml grenadine into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously in the cocktail shaker until the surface of the shaker feels chilled. Strain using a strainer into a hurricane glass filled with ice cubes.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut a wedge of pineapple and place on the rim of the glass. Cut a slice of orange and place next to the pineapple, along with a mint sprig.

name: Pimm's Royale
description: A version of the classic aperitif the Kir Royale, this switches in Pimm's for a deliciously fruity pre-dinner drink that also makes for a great party celebration drink thanks to the addition of champagne.

instructions.description: Using a jigger, measure 25ml Pimm's Strawberry with a Hint of Mint and pour into a champagne flute. Slowly top up with 75ml champagne.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, hull a strawberry and add to the drink.

name: Pink Gin
description: A mix of London Dry Gin and Angostura bitters, the Pink Gin is delicate-looking, delicious, and about as simple as a cocktail gets.

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 15ml London Dry Gin, 15ml raspberry liqueur, 10ml lemon juice and 5ml sugar syrup into the shaker.
Shake the mixture vigorously until the surface of the cocktail shaker feels chilled.Use a cocktail strainer to strain into a tall glass filled with cubed ice.

name: Cardhu Old Fashioned
description: A new twist on an old classic.

instructions.description: Add ice and a dash of bitters to a rocks glass.
Add Cardhu whisky. Add sugar syrup. Stir until chilled and strain over a julep strainer.
Garnish with dehydrated pear.
Add ice to a mixing glass.
Add a dash of bitters. Add sugar syrup. Add Talisker whisky.
Garnish, serve and enjoy.

name: Baileys Chocolate Orange S'mores martini cocktail
description: A sophisticated twist on a campfire favourite.

instructions.description: Pour melted chocolate onto one plate. Add the crushed biscuits and pearl sugar onto another. Dip the rim of a chilled glass into the melted chocolate, and then carefully straight into the biscuits and sugar. Let the glass set in the fridge.
Put the ice, Baileys, vodka, orange peel, and mint (optional) into the cocktail shaker. Shake for 30 seconds and then strain into the glass.
Carefully pour the double cream onto the top of the cocktail over the back of a spoon.
Thread a large marshmallow onto a wooden skewer and carefully toast it over a flame. Top the cocktail with the toasted marshmallow and sprinkle edible gold leaf to garnish.

name: John Collins
description: John Collins cocktails are made from Vodka, the Tom Collins is typically made using Gin. Whichever spirit you choose, Collins cocktails are crowd- pleasing and super simple to make.  Use fresh lemon juice, simple syrup and sparkling water. Its clean, crisp taste makes it the ideal sip for dinner parties.

instructions.description: In a cocktail shaker with ice, add all ingredients except the soda.
Shake for 5-7 seconds, and strain over fresh cubes in a Collins glass.Top with chilled soda.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and cherry on a pick.
Stir 1 part white sugar to 1 part warm or boiling water until the sugar is dissolved. Cool before use.

name: Dutch Mule
description: It couldn’t be simpler to combine vodka, lime, ginger and sugar to balance. Perfect after a long day.

instructions.description: Add ice to a Collins glass.
Add in the vodka, lime juice, and simple syrup to the glass. Top with chilled ginger beer.
Stir just to combine. Garnish with a wedge of lime and fresh mint.
Stir 1 part white sugar to 1 part warm or boiling water until the sugar is dissolved. Cool before use.

name: Gin Basil Smash
description: One of gin's more modern subcategories. This cocktail was born in 2008. Followed by the Green Park cocktail in 2011. There is a lovely little micro category of delicious gin and basil drinks. What a pairing!

instructions.description: Add the basil leaves, simple syrup, and lemon juice to a cocktail shaker.
Crush the basil with the muddler until bruised - this releases the oils.
Add gin and ice to the muddled ingredients, and shake until the outside of the cocktail shaker is freezing cold.
Strain into a Tumbler glass, top with ice and garnish with a sprig of basil.
Stir 1 part white sugar to 1 part warm or boiling water until the sugar is dissolved. Cool before use.

name: Gimlet
description: A drink that used to be gin and roses lime cordial has turned into a category of its own now, with bartenders using fresh fruits to create any flavoured cordial to either shake or stir up with gin. Simple yet oh-so-delicious, this classic cocktail is a great drink if you want to ease yourself into Martinis.

instructions.description: Add the ice, gin, lime juice, and simple syrup to a shaker.
Mix vigorously with a bar spoon until very cold.
Strain and pour into a chilled coupe or martini glass. Garnish and serve right away.
Stir 1 part white sugar to 1 part warm or boiling water until the sugar is dissolved. Cool before use.

name: Clover Club
description: The Clover Club is an impeccable drink to enjoy. Dry yet zesty with beautiful foam, thanks to the egg white topping. This cocktail is the perfect combination of pretty visual appeal and delightful texture.

instructions.description: Add 1 cup sugar to 1/2 cup water to a pot. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves.Reduce the heat to low and add 1/2 cup of fresh raspberries. Macerate into a pulp.Fine strain to remove the berry's seeds. Add 15ml of gin as a preserve (optional).Cool in the fridge until ready to serve.
Add a generous amount of ice to the cocktail shaker. Follow with the gin, lemon juice, raspberry syrup, and egg white.
Shake vigorously until well-chilled. The outside of the shaker should be very cold.
Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with raspberries.

name: Corpse Reviver
description: This drink was invented back in the 1930s by Harry Craddock for The Savoy Cocktail Book. This cocktail is a hit thanks to the combination of four different types of spirits.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker.
Shake in a cocktail shaker, and strain over a coupe.Garnish with a lemon peel.
Stir 1 part white sugar to 1 part warm or boiling water until the sugar is dissolved. Cool before use.

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
description: An absolute showstopper of a cocktail. Essentially a creamy version of the Tom Collins, the Ramos Gin Fizz does take a while to make as the key is in a long hard shake! For that reason, this is probably more suited for more intimate celebrations where time isn't so precious.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients minus the soda to a cocktail shaker.
Shake with ice for about 15 seconds and strain back into the shaker.Dry shake (without ice) for about 20 seconds.

Slowly pour 2/3 of the cocktail contents into the Collins glass at the same time as the soda. They should be as one while entering the glass. Hold them at a higher than normal height when pouring. Leave room at the top of the glass.
Chill the cocktail in the Collins glass in the fridge for about a minute. Take it out and slowly pour in the remaining cocktail from the shaker.This should achieve an elevated foam top.

name: Summer Punch
description: Perfect for sharing with friends, the Summer Punch combines the pureness and versatility of vodka with the subtle sweetness of apple juice, fresh lemon and ginger for a great party serve.

instructions.description: Add large chunks of ice, or large cubes, to a mug or a mason jar.
Measure 40ml vodka, 20ml lemon juice, 60ml ginger beer and 60ml apple juice into a mason jar or a mug
Using a sharp knife and chopping board, cut 2 lemon wedges. Add 1 sprig of mint and 2-3 raspberries for use as a garnish.
Stir gently and serve.
For a batch cocktail, select the amount of serves, and mix all ingredients in a large jug or bowl. Stir with a ladle, pour into individual mugs, garnish and serve.

name: Gin Martini
description: Ah, the martini. A favourite drink for everyone from Frank Sinatra to James Bond (shaken, not stirred). Although various twists on the martini are popping up everywhere, nothing beats the classic.

instructions.description: Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure out the gin and vermouth, and pour over the ice in the mixing glass.
Using a bar spoon, stir for 30 seconds. Hold back the ice and pour the cocktail into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist, olives, a dash of aromatic bitters - one or all three.

name: Rum Old Fashioned
description: Why have a standard old fashioned, when you can mix it up with a great, aged rum? Try this version with a different base, sugar, and bitters for a new twist on an iconic cocktail.

instructions.description: Stir all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice until the glass is freezing cold.
Strain and pour into an Old Fashioned tumbler with fresh ice.
Use the peeler to make a strip of grapefruit.
Twist the grapefruit peel and use it as a garnish.

name: Apple Highball
description: This is a great long drink to sip on. You can pretty much use any base spirit, but we prefer it with rum.

instructions.description: Mix all ingredients into a Collins glass with ice.You can substitute tonic water with ginger ale or ginger beer for added flavour.
Peel a twist of lemon, or cut up apple slices to garnish.

name: Hotel Nacional
description: Named after the famous Hotel Nacional in Havana, Cuba, this signature cocktail adapts the classic Daiquiri. Lauren Mote has mixed pineapple, lime juice and apricot (or peach liqueur) for a cocktail that’s smooth in taste and big on tropical flavour.

instructions.description: In a cocktail shaker with ice, add all ingredients.
Shake for 5-7 seconds and fine strain (using a tea strainer to catch the ice bits) into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Rum Manhattan
description: Global Cocktailian, Lauren Mote's vision for a mix of part spiced rum and part aged rum is visionary. This cocktail is a great way to add a little zing to a classic drink.

instructions.description: Stir all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass.
Strain neat into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with lemon or orange peel and a brandied cherry on a cocktail pick.

name: Rum Sour
description: "The most famous sour cocktails are the Margarita and the Whisky Sour, but Global Cocktailian, Lauren Mote's Rum Sour is a great contender.The combination of rum with zesty citrus is something to look forward to. It's easy to make, easy to switch up (all types of rums are welcome) and easy to enjoy, making it an excellent drink for celebrating life's big moments with your favourite people."

instructions.description: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice, and shake hard for 7-10 seconds.
Double strain using a mesh tea sieve into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve and enjoy!

name: Eggnog
description: The festive season isn’t quite celebratory enough without a glass of Eggnog. Why not try out Lauren Mote's, it's warming and delicious in equal measure.

instructions.description: Add 5 tea bags of preferred breakfast or earl grey tea to a container, and top with 300ml hot water. Steep for 10 min, strain and reserve the tea water.
Combine with 300g white sugar or honey, stir to dissolve. Store in fridge, use within 7-10 days.
Add all ingredients to a shaker, and viciously dry shake without ice to emulsify the egg. Add ice and shake hard. Double strain into a moose mug.
Top with freshly grated nutmeg.

name: Winter Mai Tai
description: No tiki cocktail party is complete without a Mai Tai. And if you’re hosting one during the colder seasons, Lauren Mote’s winterised Mai Tai will go down a storm with your guests.

instructions.description: Shake all ingredients with ice, and strain over fresh ice into a festive glass.
With fresh mint and grated almond.

name: Hot Buttered Rum
description: It's the heart-warming cocktail to serve at get-togethers during cooler seasons. Rich, comforting and delicious, Lauren Mote's rumbelievable drink will re-energise your guests before they head back home.

instructions.description: *Vanilla syrup store-bought or add ½ vanilla bean, add to a pot with 500ml 1:1 simple syrup, bring to a simmer, and shut off the heat. Cover and allow to steep for 4 hours. Strain and use. Store in fridge, use within 7-10 days
Strain and pour into an Old Fashioned tumbler with fresh ice.
Add to a glass and garnish with lemon peel.Express the oils along the top of the cocktail, and then layer the peel across the top of the glass. Serve immediately.

name: Captain Morgan's Spiced Hot Toddy
description: When the temperature drops, nothing beats catching up over Lauren Mote's super special Hot Toddy cocktail with your nearest and dearest. This version is a spicy twist on the traditional recipe.

instructions.description: Add 40ml of Captain Morgan Original Spiced Gold, 30ml of lemon juice and a tablespoon of honey to your favourite mug.Sprinkle in 3 cloves, a slice of lemon and a cinnamon stick.
Fill the mug to the top with boiling water. Stir and enjoy hot.

name: Blackberry Whisky
description: Imagined and crafted by a master of mixology, Ervin Trykowski who summoned some of his finest flaire by marrying the worlds of blackberries and whisky in this Blackberry Whisky cocktail.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Muddle blackberries into your glass.
Combine the remaining ingredients, shake everything with some ice, and serve over more ice in a rocks glass.
For those who don't love blackberries, substitute with your preferred berry.

name: Sunrise Highball
description: Ervin Trykowski has a knack for unlocking hidden depths of flavour in whisky.. This Sunrise Highball with lashings of orange soda does exactly that!

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Black Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Combine the whisky and soda in a highball glass and top with fresh OJ.
Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Elderflower Spritz
description: A toast-worthy tasty long drink made for any occasion.

instructions.description: Add 40ml Gin 0.0% to a wine glass with 15ml elderflower cordial. Fill your wine glass with ice before topping your cocktail with deliciously balanced Fever-Tree White Grape & Apricot Soda.

Give it a gentle stir and garnish with a fresh mint sprig.The more ice in your spritz, the longer your drink will stay chilled. The less ice, the quicker it will dilute. So, make sure you’ve got plenty in there!

name: Lemon Sour
description: When life gives you lemons, make Lemon Sour cocktails for everyone.

instructions.description: Add 50ml Tanqueray 0.0% to your shaker, along with 30ml fresh lemon juice and 15ml simple syrup. Add 1 egg white or 20ml aquafaba, then close your shaker and gently shake to activate the texture.
Open the shaker, add plenty of ice, and give it a hard shake.

Strain into a rock glass over ice and garnish with a lemon twist. TIP: Use a potato peeler to peel a long thin strip off your lemon. Roll this lemon twist over the cocktail and watch as the lemon oils from the peel fly over the cocktail.

name: Penicillin Cocktail
description: Tim Philips-Johansson has created yet another show-stopping sip with this Penicillin Cocktail. It's warm and sweetly anointed with the Johnnie Walker Gold, honey and ginger syrup.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker (except Lagavulin).
Add ice to the shaker and shake for 10 seconds until cold. Strain mix onto fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Garnish with Lagavulin float and candied ginger.

name: Garden Highball
description: A delicious cocktail encompassing all the refreshing flavour of the British countryside.

instructions.description: Chop your cucumber into a few long and thin discs. Add 50ml Tanqueray 0.0% to a shaker with 50ml cloudy apple juice, 20ml elderflower cordial and 10ml lemon juice. Pop a couple of cucumber discs in there, too, for added freshness.
Add ice to the shaker and give it a good old shake before straining into a highball glass full of ice.
Garnish with a fresh cucumber disc and mint sprig. Top the glass with a splash of soda for some effervescence.

name: Vodka Espresso
description: A classic cocktail 99% of your party will love!

instructions.description: Mix all ingredients in a mixing glass. Shake well with ice and fine strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with three coffee beans on top.

name: Spiced Apple Sour
description: This cosy sour is the perfect non-alcoholic cocktail for your festive get togethers.

instructions.description: Add 40ml Gin 0.0%, 50ml cloudy apple juice, 15ml fresh lemon juice, 15ml cinnamon syrup & 1 egg white to a shaker.
Shake without ice gently, then shake a second time with ice to get the fluffy texture. Strain into a coupette and garnish with a light dusting of cinnamon.
Strain into a coupette and garnish with a light dusting of cinnamon.

name: Gordon's Alcohol Free Spirit winter & tonic
description: A seasonal Gordon's 0.0% and Tonic twist, without the alcohol. Let’s cheers to that.

instructions.description: Add 50ml Gordon's 0.0% Alcohol-Free Spirit to a highball glass, and top with either Fever-Tree Clementine Tonic or Fever-Tree Aromatic tonic.
Garnish with an orange twist and 1 x star anise.

name: Mi-no-sa
description: The ultimate crowd pleaser! A non alcoholic Mimosa. Perfect with brunch, early dinners, celebrations and much more.

instructions.description: Add 30ml Gin 0.0% to a champagne flute with 30ml orange juice.
Add 10ml Monin blood orange syrup and top with soda.

name: Ervin's Old Fashioned
description: Make Ervin's Old Fashioned in a new way by crafting it in batches. This is the perfect sipper for a pre-dinner soiree.

instructions.description: Using the funnel add the whisky, simple syrup, bitters and water to a clean 1L glass bottle.
Seal the bottle and give it a gentle swirl to mix all the ingredients. Keep in the fridge until ready to use.
When you're ready to serve, pour into tumbler(s), express an orange peel over each drink and then use the peel to garnish.

name: Queen Bee
description: Christie Knight, the queen bee of alcohol-free mixes, has conjured up a deliciously fresh combination of  honey, lemon juice, soda water and thyme. The fresh, woody sparkle will set your night afire.

instructions.description: To make honey water, mix equal parts honey and boiling water, and stir until combined.
Fill a highball glass with cubed ice. Pour in gin 0.0%, lemon juice and honey water and stir. Top-up the highball glass with more ice.
Add a fresh thyme sprig into the glass and then top-up with soda water and give the cocktail one more stir before serving.

name: Ervin's Whisky Sour
description: Unlike most Whiskey Sour recipes, Ervin Trykowski's Whisky Sours aren't made with bourbon, so we do not add the letter 'e' in whisk(e)y. Instead expect sour, salty, spicy flavours in this cocktail.

instructions.description: Pour all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Add the whisky, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Shake well. Strain into a chilled rocks glass.
Garnish with a cherry or lemon peel. And enjoy!

name: Johnnie Walker Whisky Sour
description: A Johnnie Walker Whisky Sour made by Tim Philips-Johansson is like no other because it relies on those gently spiced vanilla notes for an extra special flavour derived from the whisky.

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker® Red Label® Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Put ice and all the ingredients into a shaker and shake hard for 20 seconds to chill the liquid.
Strain the mix into a glass filled with ice and garnish.

name: Whisky Colada
description: Try Ervin’s twist on the Piña Colada using Talisker whiskey here. And We love Ervin’s take on this classic, but if you prefer your Pina with Tequila, see the original recipe.

instructions.description: Shake the drink with cubed ice and serve in a small coupe.
Garnish with pineapple – or a small boat sail!

name: Pink Gin Spritz
description: Pippa’s Pink Gin Fizz is the perfect party starter! The flirty, soft pink colour of Gordon's Pink Gin is made to sparkle with Prosecco.  Don't forget to use our serve calculator to turn into a sharing pitcher & estimate the amount of ingredients you'll need to buy.

instructions.description: Fill a large wine glass with ice.
Mix in the Pink Gin and lemonade. Top with Prosecco and stir gently.
Throw in a few fresh strawberries.

name: Scotch Old Fashioned
description: Arguably the world's oldest cocktail, the Old-Fashioned, is a deceptively simple blend of whiskey, sugar and bitters, and a must for any lover of dark spirits seeking perfection in a glass. Try this twist with Johnnie Walker Scotch whisky.

instructions.description: Combine all the ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass and stir well. Serve this cocktail in a tumbler, over one large cube or several small ones.
Express the orange peel over the glass to release the aromatic oils. And don't forget to garnish with the orange peel and a sprig of toasted rosemary.

name: Don Limonada
description: Karina Sánchez saw the beautiful point where fresh lemon meets the taste of sweet agave. If you're looking for a simple serve where tequila takes centre stage, this is it.

instructions.description: Add ingredients to a shaker. Muddle and then add ice and shake.
Pour into a rocks glass and top up with sparkling water.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Tequila Old Fashioned
description: Bartender Karina Sánchez Huitrón has created a Tequila Old Fashioned that is set to wow all who taste it. Grapefruit bitters enliven the glass, while smoky, aged Añejo gives it body and makes it a sneaky twist to the original.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients to a mixing glass over ice. Stir until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a rocks glass over a large-format ice cube.
Garnish with an orange peel.

name: Tanqueray Alcohol Free 0.0% & Tonic
description: Enjoy one of the world’s most famous alcohol-free mixes. Experiment with tonics, the way Christie Knight does, using the same measures and find your favourite.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml Tanqueray Alcohol Free 0.0%, 125ml tonic water and 10ml lime juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut 2 wedges of lime to place in the drink to garnish.

name: Grapefruit Collins
description: Grapefruit and rosemary are an absolutely delicious combination, especially with this herbaceous garnish. Bartender Christie Knight knows the importance of drink garnish. You smell the aroma of your drink before it hits your lips, which strongly affects how you taste it.  Christie made this with Tanqueray 0.0% but you can just as easily swap for Tanqueray London Dry, or Tanqueray 10.

instructions.description: Add 50ml gin 0.0% to a highball glass, with 50ml fresh pink grapefruit juice and 10ml simple syrup. Stir well. Add ice to the glass, stir again, then top the glass with soda water.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

name: Non-Alcoholic Clover Club
description: Aquafaba is a great alternative to those who prefer not to use egg white in their drinks. It is the liquid from a can of chickpeas, believe it or not, doesn't add much flavour but does replicate the amazing fluffy texture of a sour. Give this recipe developed by Christie Knight a go!

instructions.description: Add 50ml gin 0.0%, 25ml fresh lemon juice, 15ml of your syrup and a few fresh raspberries to a shaker. Add your egg white or 20ml aquafaba if you prefer not to use an egg.

Close the shaker and gently shake it, being careful to hold the shaker at both ends. Open it up, add your ice, and shake for a second time, this time much more firmly. Double strain the cocktail through a fine strainer into a martini glass, and garnish with a fresh raspberry.
Double strain the cocktail through a fine strainer into a martini glass, and garnish with a fresh raspberry.

name: Tanqueray 0.0% Gimlet
description: Doyenne of the no-alcohol cocktail, Christie Knight, has created a non-alcoholic gimlet using gin 0.0% with fresh lime. This mix is intense fresh and here to delight your guests.

instructions.description: Add the ice, gin, lime juice, and simple syrup to a shaker and shake vigorously with a bar spoon until very cold
Strain and pour into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a lime peel and serve right away

name: Gin and Tonic
description: One of the world’s most famous mixes- the Gin and Tonic. We recommend a Gin full of juniper and botanical flavours, with the slightly bitter tonic. Experiment with different gin's & tonics using the same measures and find your favourite.

instructions.description: Fill a tall glass with ice cubes.
Using a jigger, measure 25ml London Dry Gin, 125ml tonic water and 10ml lime juice into the glass.
With a chopping board and sharp knife, cut 2 wedges of lime to place in the drink to garnish.

name: Gordon's Premium Pink Spritz
description: A delicious, light, and fruity drink witha bubbly twist and juniper notes.

instructions.description: Fill Copa Glass with all the ingedients
stir to mix
Add Strawberry as garnish and serve

name: Gordon's Premium Pink & Tonic
description: A refreshing tasting Gordon’s & Tonicwith a fruity Pink twist

instructions.description: Fill Copa Glass with all the ingedients
stir to mix
Add Strawberry as garnish and serve

name: Raspberry & Basil Clover Club
description: For the ultimate host

instructions.description: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker and shake with no ice
Add ice in for the second shake and double strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish with a basil leaf in the centre.

name: Pink Grapefruit Spritz
description: This zippy and zesty pink grapefruit gin has a delicious grapefruit flavour, along with the classic taste of juniper and lime..

instructions.description: Build the first 2 ingredients in a wine glass and stir to combine.
Add cubed ice and top with your favourite prosecco or sparkling wine and add a dash of soda water.
Garnish with a slice of pink grapefruit.

name: Grove & Tonic
description: One of our classic non-alcoholic serves with citrus notes from Seedlip Grove 42

instructions.description: Put ice cubes in highball glass
Pour in 50ml of Seedlip Grove 42 and 125ml of Indian tonic water
Stir the mixture thoroughly using a bar spoon until well combined.
Add 3 coffee beans to the top of the drink to garnish.

name: Tanqueray Nº Ten And Tonic
description: One of the world’s most famous mixes- is the Gin and Tonic. We recommend a Gin full of juniper and botanical flavours, with a slightly bitter tonic. Experiment with different gin's & tonics using the same measures and find your favourite.

instructions.description: Pour 50ml of Tanqueray Nº Ten Gin into a copa glass,
Add plenty of ice
Mix with 150ml of premium tonic water
Add a wedge of grapefruit to garnish and stir

name: Espresso Martino
description: A coffee lover’s dream, this twist on the Espresso Martini substitutes the vodka for Spice 94

instructions.description: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
Shake & Strain 50ml Seedlip Spice 94, 50ml of Espresso & 15ml Sugar Syrup. Using a cocktail strainer, strain into a Coupe glass.
Add 3 coffee beans to the top of the drink to garnish.

name: Seedlip Apple Highball
description: A non alcoholic Apple cocktail with unfiltered Apple Juice

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except soda water to a cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake & strain into a chilled highball glassTop with soda & add fresh ice.
Garnish with an Apple fan

name: Cîroc French Garden
description: Cîroc French Garden

instructions.description: Put ice in a highball glass
Pour ingredients in the highball
Gently stir
Garnish with mint

name: Cîroc Red Berry Punch
description: Cîroc Red Berry Punch

instructions.description: Put ice in a highball glass
Pour ingredients in the highball
Gently stir

name: Cîroc Pineapple Spritz
description: Cîroc Pineapple Spritz

instructions.description: Put ice in a highball glass
Pour ingredients in the highball
Gently stir

name: Dark Toffee Boulevardier
description: Dark Toffee Boulevardier

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker Black Label (72 Hour Cacao Nib Infused)

instructions.description: Add cubed ice to mixing glass.
Measure Johnnie Walker into mixing glassMeasure Bitter aperitif and Sweet vermouth into mixing glass
Stir and strain into a rocks glass over a rough-cut ice block.
Add a quarter fig.

name: The Creamy Tangy Whisky Sour
description: The Creamy Tangy Whisky Sour

instructions.description: Measure Johnnie Walker into shaking tinMeasure all other ingredients into shaking tin
Add cubed ice to tin.
Shake & strain into an ice-filled rocks glass
Sear a skewered marshmallow and place on top of the drink.

name: Rich & Smoky Manhattan
description: Rich & Smoky Manhattan

instructions.description: Add cubed ice to mixing glass.
Measure Johnnie Walker into mixing glass.Measure Sweet vermouth into a mixing glass.Dash Bitters into mixing glass.
Stir and strain into a chilled coupette
Add a dried apricot on a pick

name: The Sweet & Nutty Affogato
description: The Sweet & Nutty Affogato

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker Black Label Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Spoon pistachio ice cream into a glass
Measure Johnnie Walker Black into a glass.
Pour coffee into glass
Add gold/brass spoon

name: The Smooth & Floral Old Fashioned
description: The Smooth & Floral Old Fashioned

ingredients.name: Johnnie Walker Black Label Blended Scotch Whisky

instructions.description: Place rough-cut block into glass
Measure Johnnie Walker into a glass.Measure Elderflower cordial into glass.Dash orange bitters into glass.
Stir liquid and ice in the glass.
Spritz a lemon zest over the top. Place elderflower in the glass.

name: Vodka Murdini
description: Murdoc Niccals is regarded by the Gorillaz community as Pickle and we wouldn’t put it past him to consider himself the ideal candidate for the next Bond, so it was a no brainer to take shaken, not stirred classic and whack a pickle in it. Hold the olive

instructions.description: Fill cocktail shaker with ice.
Measure Smirnoff Vodka, Vermouth and brine in jigger and pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
Double strain into a cold martini glass.
Garnish with pickles.

name: Smirnoff Brooklyn
description: Russel Hobbs is from Brooklyn, straight up (no ice) and whilst the modern Manhattan sits on the darker side, Hobbs is here to lighten things up with a twist on the OG Smirnoff vodka original recipe… Hold the cherry.

instructions.description: Measure both Smirnoff Vodka and Vermouth in jigger and pour cocktail ingredients into mixing glass with ice.
Add 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters and 2-3 slices of chilli.
Stir down until cold and strain into a cold martini glass.
Garnish with whole chili

name: Sayonara martini
description: Wave goodbye to the expected and say hello to new flavours. Enter passionfruit and welcome echoes of life in Japan with yuzu sake. A delicate touch of Vanilla finishes to complete Noodle’s Sayonara martini...

instructions.description: Fill the cocktail shaker with ice.
Measure Smirnoff Vodka and other cocktail ingredients in jigger.
Pour into a cocktail shaker, shake until cold and double strain into a cold martini glass.
Garnish with half passion fruit.

name: Vodka Eyeball
description: 2D famously has a pair of eyes that for reasons unknown go from black to white and keeps a pet satsuma. Meet the Eyeball. He still doesn’t know it’s actually called Highball, hence the gummy eye candies… Hold the lemon

ingredients.name: Fresh Lemon Juice - Squeezed From A Large Wedge

instructions.description: Fill the cocktail shaker with ice.
Measure Smirnoff Vodka and other cocktail ingredients in jigger.
Pour into a cocktail shaker, shake until cold and double strain into a cold martini glass.
Garnish with eyeballs candies.

name: Spiced Espresso Martini
description: Spiced Espresso Martini

instructions.description: Simply shake all ingredients together with ice
Strain into a martini glass
Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon, three coffee beans and enjoy!

name: Festive Old Fashioned
description: Festive Old Fashioned

instructions.description: Stir the Haig Club, the gingerbread syrup and the bitters together with large ice cubes in a mixing glass for a full minute, until the drink is well chilled and has diluted down
Add a couple of large ice cubes to a rocks glass and strain the mix into this.
Twist the orange peel above the glass to spray the oils across the top of the drink and drop in the peel to garnish

name: Haig Hot Toddy
description: Haig Hot Toddy

ingredients.name: Slice Of Lemon And Its Peel

instructions.description: Add everything except the Haig Club to a pan and bring to a simmer
Reduce the temperature but continue warming for 10-15 minutes allowing the flavours to combine.
Add Haig Club, stir and then strain the mixture into a glass latte mug and garnish with the lemon peel

name: Baileys Salted Caramel Espresso Martini
description: If you fancy the suave appeal of an espresso martini cocktail but want to treat yourself, this one goes out to you. Oozing in salted caramel sauce, a perfectly frothy martini cocktail with a difference. Yum!

instructions.description: Drizzle some salted caramel sauce around the rim of the martini glass.
Add your ice into your cocktail shaker.
Add 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream, 1-2 Shots of cold espresso, 15ml Salted Caramel Syrup.
Shake it and then stir it into your cocktail glass to serve

name: Baileys Chocolate Orange Martini Cocktail
description: Love Baileys? Love chocolate orange? Tangy, sharp sweetness meeting creamy chocolatey velvet. Tell me you don’t fancy one now I’ve brought it up…..

instructions.description: Add your ice into your cocktail shaker.
Add 50ml Baileys Original Irish Cream, 25ml Triple Sec, 75ml Milk (or for extra yum try half milk half cream).
Shake it baby and then strain into your cocktail glass.
Garnish with a slice of chocolate orange or grate over the top and serve!

name: Seville Marmalade Negroni
description: A twisted classic

instructions.description: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass
Stir with cubed ice until thoroughly chilled. Strain into a rocks glass over cubed ice
Garnish with fresh orange peel.
